commit_message:
Restrict usage of Radosgw if swift for images is selected

Deployment when we enable Radosgw and have Swift for Glance
is wrong. In this case radosgw works as swift api and stores
glance images in rgw.bucket rbd storage instead of swift storage.

Partial-Bug: 1604879
Change-Id: I8cf0fa0a408a71ed4d624e5d0f3855bf6ee64065

commit_message:
Restrict usage of Radosgw if swift for images is selected

Deployment when we enable Radosgw and have Swift for Glance
is wrong. In this case radosgw works as swift api and stores
glance images in rgw.bucket rbd storage instead of swift storage.

Partial-Bug: 1604879
Change-Id: I8cf0fa0a408a71ed4d624e5d0f3855bf6ee64065

commit_message:
Serialize mtu for dpdk interface with 'i40e' driver

On NIC: XL710 with driver 'i40e'  MTU does not take into
account 4 bytes VLAN tag, so we should increase it manually

DocImpact
Change-Id: I3d95db9ec6fae4d8cd397c429d785dbdf1502b21
Partial-Bug: #1587310
Co-Authored-By: Fedor Zhadaev <fzhadaev@mirantis.com>

If that value changes, new DNS domain will be applied

commit_message:
Add dns_domain field for network_config model

Now value of DNS domain for a cluster is fetched from
/etc/fuel/astute.yaml file on a master node.
If that value changes, new DNS domain will be applied
for an environment in case of its update. This may lead
to unexpected behavior. That's why dns_domain should be stored
in nailgun database for every environment.

Change-Id: I35eeeac9cdc1bb4bb7c93ceda9fff6979b84f382
Closes-Bug: #1641140

subject: Validate that plugins exist before sync procedure
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 8392, 'name': 'Aleksey Kasatkin', 'email': 'akasatkin@mirantis.com', 'username': 'aleksey'}, {'_account_id': 8931, 'name': 'Artem Roma', 'email': 'aroma@mirantis.com', 'username': 'aateem'}, {'_account_id': 8971, 'name': 'Fuel CI', 'username': 'fuel-ci', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10391, 'name': 'Ihor Kalnytskyi', 'email': 'ihor@kalnytskyi.com', 'username': 'ikalnitsky'}, {'_account_id': 10488, 'name': 'Artur Svechnikov', 'email': 'asvechnikov@mirantis.com', 'username': 'asvechnikov'}, {'_account_id': 10959, 'name': 'Alexander Kislitsky', 'email': 'akislitsky@mirantis.com', 'username': 'akislitsky'}, {'_account_id': 11898, 'name': 'Alexander Saprykin', 'email': 'cutwatercore@gmail.com', 'username': 'asaprykin'}, {'_account_id': 18446, 'name': 'vkulanov', 'email': 'vitaliy@kulanov.org.ua', 'username': 'vkulanov'}, {'_account_id': 20656, 'name': 'Fuel Packaging CI', 'email': 'ci+fuel-packaging@mirantis.com', 'username': 'fuel-packaging-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 21013, 'name': 'Georgy Kibardin', 'email': 'gkibardin@mirantis.com', 'username': 'gkibardin'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-04-05 12:54:09.000000000', 'files': ['nailgun/nailgun/test/integration/test_plugins_api.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/plugins/manager.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/api/v1/validators/plugin.py'], 'message': 'Validate that plugins exist before sync procedure

There are two problems in Nailgun if we try to sync all plugins
that actually not even exist (neither in db nor on filesystem).
1. By default 'plugins' directory in '/var/www/nailgun/' does not
exist that leads to an error if we try to sync plugins before
install them.
2. If 'plugins' directory exists, but doesn't contain any plugins
and there are no any installed plugins in db, Nailgun reports
confusing message "Plugins were successfully synchronized."
So, this patch adds extra validation procedure that allows sync
plugins only if they exist in Nailgun (either db or filesystem)

Change-Id: Id06d2da1174bbed512c26cff22f51de91100c66d
Closes-Bug: 1677627
'}]
commit_message:
Validate that plugins exist before sync procedure

There are two problems in Nailgun if we try to sync all plugins
that actually not even exist (neither in db nor on filesystem).
1. By default 'plugins' directory in '/var/www/nailgun/' does not
exist that leads to an error if we try to sync plugins before
install them.
2. If 'plugins' directory exists, but doesn't contain any plugins
and there are no any installed plugins in db, Nailgun reports
confusing message "Plugins were successfully synchronized."
So, this patch adds extra validation procedure that allows sync
plugins only if they exist in Nailgun (either db or filesystem)

Change-Id: Id06d2da1174bbed512c26cff22f51de91100c66d
Closes-Bug: 1677627

commit_message:
Ceph pool creation should be called only once

PG number should'n be updated on adding ceph-osd nodes.
It should be done manually by user only after new node is
sucessfully joined and rebalance is finished.

Change-Id: I4ec7ab8b713fd488dd63e83491d1b60966420d00
Closes-Bug: #1668553

commit_message:
Excluding number of nodes in stop operation notification

Nailgun use block of nodes in stop operation to reset
such nodes in discovery state. Also Nailgun used such
data to calculate count of nodes for notifications.
But Astute will not send info about nodes in case
of task deployment.

This patch exclude count of nodes in stop notification
to prevent misslining message about successful operation
for 0 nodes

Change-Id: I32da2ccce11b22378f58759703fc4a56e31fd993
Closes-Bug: #1672964
(cherry picked from commit 3fb3b83f4ad1254a9a54d6d81f5c58f33c92c601)

commit_message:
Reexecute tasks merging to deployment task removed

Merge of the reexecute tasks into the deployment causes
tasks order violations. As solution we are adding reexecute
tasks after deployment tasks.

Also fixed wrong log message format, mistypes in comments and
dockstrings.

Change-Id: Ic029973f673658c2ff00a5eb4561bdfcfa960cd6
Closes-Bug: #1644871

Scenario:
1. Execute nova neutron agent-list command on a controller node.
2. Check there are no failed services (with False state).

1. Execute cinder service-list command on a controller node.
2. Check there are no failed services (with down state).

Change-Id: Ie3b204c650473be65354cbbdd72dc8b70640421b
Closes-Bug: #1571741
'}]
commit_message:
Add sanity tests for checking cinder and neutron services

Scenario:
1. Execute nova neutron agent-list command on a controller node.
2. Check there are no failed services (with False state).

1. Execute cinder service-list command on a controller node.
2. Check there are no failed services (with down state).

Change-Id: Ie3b204c650473be65354cbbdd72dc8b70640421b
Closes-Bug: #1571741

commit_message:
Restrict usage of Radosgw if swift for images is selected

Deployment when we enable Radosgw and have Swift for Glance
is wrong. In this case radosgw works as swift api and stores
glance images in rgw.bucket rbd storage instead of swift storage.

Partial-Bug: 1604879
Change-Id: I8cf0fa0a408a71ed4d624e5d0f3855bf6ee64065

commit_message:
Change disk size check

Sometimes order of disks can be changed. So we need
to select disk using type ("qcow2" by default) but
not by index.

Change-Id: I481eb79eff22b990c61d2397d6c96bd93df6687f
Closes-Bug: 1670711
(cherry picked from commit 3d22d0c2662c6586f16a32e37a6f20e4a6889692)

Release plugins add new feature to provide

Tests are verifying stability of that transport
for release enablement.

subject: Do not sync time after restarting of node
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-30 13:04:46.000000000', 'files': ['fuelweb_test/tests/test_support_hugepages.py', 'fuelweb_test/models/fuel_web_client.py', 'fuelweb_test/tests/test_ceph.py', 'fuelweb_test/tests/test_cgroups.py'], 'message': 'Do not sync time after restarting of node

We have weird bug that can spawn 2 ntpd processes at the same time
by HA mechanism. Actually we have to sync time strictly only after
reverting a snapshot.

Change-Id: Ic73eb942eaacb436629841f9b12df844f3ac736d
Related-bug:1656020
'}]
commit_message:
Do not sync time after restarting of node

We have weird bug that can spawn 2 ntpd processes at the same time
by HA mechanism. Actually we have to sync time strictly only after
reverting a snapshot.

Change-Id: Ic73eb942eaacb436629841f9b12df844f3ac736d
Related-bug:1656020

subject: Consolidate fuel CLI client capabilities
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-08-31 19:27:55.000000000', 'files': ['specs/10.0/consolidate-fuel-client.rst'], 'message': 'Consolidate fuel CLI client capabilities

We have two versions of fuelclient which are respectively available
with fuel and fuel2 commands. There is no feature parity between them
and it is often quite confusing which version of client a user need
to run. We need to leave only one version.

Change-Id: I9cdce2f555f5368f11a842427f24592c73ddedc3
'}]
commit_message:
Consolidate fuel CLI client capabilities

We have two versions of fuelclient which are respectively available
with fuel and fuel2 commands. There is no feature parity between them
and it is often quite confusing which version of client a user need
to run. We need to leave only one version.

Change-Id: I9cdce2f555f5368f11a842427f24592c73ddedc3

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-11 06:25:53.000000000', 'files': ['specs/8.0/deb-packages-naming-policy.rst'], 'message': 'OpenStack packages versioning rules: avoid race between stable and master

'}]
commit_message:
OpenStack packages versioning rules: avoid race between stable and master

OpenStack packages are not special at all and should use the same rules
to avoid the "version race" between the stable (also known as GA) and
develelopment branches.

Change-Id: Ifbbfa27a234870194e23213e3e49e2018187c626

commit_message:
Document and test IPv6 networking in Fuel

Since IPv6 is supported in OpenStack, we have to provide end users with
the documentation how to deploy and use provider and tenant IPv6-enabled
networks, and also cover it with tests to prevent degradation.

This will be first phase of IPv6 enablement in Fuel.

Change-Id: I8dc7ffb29548006fb8c9e9e64ac74816487eefba
Implements: blueprint provider-tenant-ipv6-networking

commit_message:
Removed self.doc_link from fuel platform tests for murano (linux)

The URL for self.doc_link was outdated, and had been moved.
causing the link to 404 when clicked.

self.doc_link was removed in order to keep consistency across
the project (other instances had been removed) and URLs are hard
to maintain across releases.

The message now says: "Murano image was not properly regstered or
was not uploaded at all. Please refer to the Mirantis Openstack
documentation to find out how to upload and/or how to register
image for Murano"

Change-Id: I124a2b657a39122d1801136ccda3f5d3bda9a2c4
Closed-bug: #1588211

commit_message:
Fixed issue with ports checks

OSTF tests don't have direct access to VMs ports,
we need to check availability of these ports from
OpenStack controller nodes instead of Fuel master node.

Change-Id: I90c4980cefb8fc650d1c2d2f4f92e98815bda98f
Closes-Bug: #1495699

subject: Workaround HEAT API race condition
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 8931, 'name': 'Artem Roma', 'email': 'aroma@mirantis.com', 'username': 'aateem'}, {'_account_id': 8971, 'name': 'Fuel CI', 'username': 'fuel-ci', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 12631, 'name': 'Bogun Dmitriy', 'email': 'dbogun@mirantis.com', 'username': 'dbogun'}, {'_account_id': 15984, 'name': 'Vladimir Khlyunev', 'email': 'vkhlyunev@mirantis.com', 'username': 'vkhlyunev'}, {'_account_id': 17503, 'name': 'Sergey Kreys', 'email': 'skreys@mirantis.com', 'username': 'skreys'}, {'_account_id': 20519, 'name': 'Volodymyr Shypyguzov', 'email': 'fg.blaze@gmail.com', 'username': 'vshypyguzov'}, {'_account_id': 20656, 'name': 'Fuel Packaging CI', 'email': 'ci+fuel-packaging@mirantis.com', 'username': 'fuel-packaging-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-06-06 19:35:11.000000000', 'files': ['fuel_health/tests/tests_platform/test_heat.py', 'fuel_health/heatmanager.py'], 'message': 'Workaround HEAT API race condition

HEAT API contain race condition. When you start stack update operation, there
is some time gap between "update" call and update of "stack_status" field.
So if we have a stack in CREATE_COMPLETE state and make update request.
Some subsequent "stack read" calls will return stack with
stack_status=CREATE_COMPLETE.

It become even worse when you have stack in UPDATE_COMPLETE state and make
one more update call. In this case, when you "read" stack with
stack_status=UPDATE_COMPLETE can’t reliable determine is operation already
finished or not even started.

So, to track HEAT’s stack “complete” status, we must track not only
stack_status field, but something else. Stack record contain field
“updated_time”. Experiments shows, that this field is being updated at the
end of update operation. So stack_status plus updated_time give us way to
reliable check is heat still working.

This change contain update, that extend “wait for heat” logic. It check
and stack_status and updated_time(if we wait for update action).

Change-Id: I36d561d6044e78015734ff18a820d1097c93c2b9
Closes-bug: #1543580
'}]
commit_message:
Workaround HEAT API race condition

HEAT API contain race condition. When you start stack update operation, there
is some time gap between "update" call and update of "stack_status" field.
So if we have a stack in CREATE_COMPLETE state and make update request.
Some subsequent "stack read" calls will return stack with
stack_status=CREATE_COMPLETE.

It become even worse when you have stack in UPDATE_COMPLETE state and make
one more update call. In this case, when you "read" stack with
stack_status=UPDATE_COMPLETE can’t reliable determine is operation already
finished or not even started.

So, to track HEAT’s stack “complete” status, we must track not only
stack_status field, but something else. Stack record contain field
“updated_time”. Experiments shows, that this field is being updated at the
end of update operation. So stack_status plus updated_time give us way to
reliable check is heat still working.

This change contain update, that extend “wait for heat” logic. It check
and stack_status and updated_time(if we wait for update action).

Change-Id: I36d561d6044e78015734ff18a820d1097c93c2b9
Closes-bug: #1543580

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-27 11:43:06.000000000', 'files': ['fuel_health/nmanager.py'], 'message': 'Modification of timeouts for server deletion

Current timeout is 20 sec, and 10 sec retry period.
In case slow instance removing we are falling to error.

Closes-Bug: 1637462

commit_message:
Modification of timeouts for server deletion

Current timeout is 20 sec, and 10 sec retry period.
In case slow instance removing we are falling to error.
New intervals make procedure more correct to check real
removing state few times.

Change-Id: I38c0d5663ac5359a21f95f4dc0fbb32c8fb256bc
Closes-Bug: 1637462

commit_message:
Check network roles after node reassigning.

Checks that network roles mapping from an original cluster is a subset
of network roles mapping of a new cluster. Use info from network
templates if any.

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-03-02 15:30:47.000000000', 'files': ['agent'], 'message': "Set max_speed of NIC to its current speed

Nailgun agent can't get speed from some type of fiber NIC
on discovered nodes.
The issue is in rethtool lib which is required by nailgun-agent.
For some reason Fiber NIC don't return any value in advertised parameter.

Author:     Dima Herasimenko <dherasimenko@mirantis.com>

Change-Id: Icff3b91eb81c13f9b89ebcd25615a9c1a2aa2dab
Closes-Bug: #1537104

commit_message:
Set max_speed of NIC to its current speed

Nailgun agent can't get speed from some type of fiber NIC
on discovered nodes.
The issue is in rethtool lib which is required by nailgun-agent.
For some reason Fiber NIC don't return any value in advertised parameter.

Author:     Dima Herasimenko <dherasimenko@mirantis.com>

Change-Id: Icff3b91eb81c13f9b89ebcd25615a9c1a2aa2dab
Closes-Bug: #1537104

commit_message:
Revert "Enable mirantis feature group by default"

DO NOT MERGE.
That commit caused community ISO to be built with "mirantis" feature enabled. Let's use this revert commit to build community ISO and upload it to fuel-infra.org.

This reverts commit 84182825fb32c300fb1a225d340a175314389c2f.
Related-Bug: #1553556

Change-Id: I51294db111496f5b8f4201eefd2d6f0a108a07a6

commit_message:
api-ref: avoid mushy wording around server.image description

This disambiguates the description on the server.image parameter.
If the server is booted from volume (where boot from volume means
there is a bdm with boot_index=0 and destination_type=volume),
then the server.image will be an empty string [1] otherwise it
will be a dict.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/2f0f8b8cf13b7441ce6a7a524b33d30d40f1d468/nova/api/openstack/compute/views/servers.py#L540

Change-Id: Ia1ecd39a5636fa5a35cdbcafc03828b2925a9033

commit_message:
Add etc/neutron/*.sample files to be ignored by git

After migration of networking-ovn code to neutron there is
e.g. etc/neutron/ovn.ini.sample file generated now and it should be
ignored by git.

Change-Id: I0d2c703d57552f8fcecc25b07c5e0d8b5aa67c29
Related-Blueprint: neutron-ovn-merge

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-11 10:13:16.000000000', 'files': ['files/fuel-docker-utils/functions.sh'], 'message': "Gracefully fail backup if postgres container is down

If a user runs `dockerctl backup' when a postgres container is not
running, a backup procedure will crash while trying to generate an SQL

Closes-Bug: #1543107
"}]
commit_message:
Gracefully fail backup if postgres container is down

If a user runs `dockerctl backup' when a postgres container is not
running, a backup procedure will crash while trying to generate an SQL
dump file.

We should ensure the postgres container is running; and if it is not
then display an error message.

Change-Id: I872de7e893e2d1d9689219fb244c7ff23ba38044
Closes-Bug: #1543107

commit_message:
Add ability to override MTU for networks

* This patch make ability for override ML2/path_mtu into:
      quantum_settings:
        . . .
        L2:
          segmentation_type: tun
          path_mtu: 8000
          tunnel_id_ranges: 2:65535

Change-Id: Ibb4c984751cd234db4a481819e390a79c27545d0
Closes-bug: #1589944

[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-07-19 09:06:44.000000000', 'files': ['files/fuel-ha-utils/ocf/rabbitmq'], 'message': 'Fix half-hearted attempt to erase mnesia in OCF RA

ocf_run does $("$@"), so "${MNESIA_FILES}/*" wasn't expanded and mnesia
directory wasn't actually cleaned up.

It's safe to remove that directory completely - it will be re-created
automatically by mnesia.

Upstream https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-server/pull/724

Change-Id: I0aa47f61e03c99ee6ebb56b833463cdf4ccd243e
Closes-Bug: 1565868
'}]
commit_message:
Fix half-hearted attempt to erase mnesia in OCF RA

ocf_run does $("$@"), so "${MNESIA_FILES}/*" wasn't expanded and mnesia
directory wasn't actually cleaned up.

It's safe to remove that directory completely - it will be re-created
automatically by mnesia.

Upstream https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-server/pull/724

Change-Id: I0aa47f61e03c99ee6ebb56b833463cdf4ccd243e
Closes-Bug: 1565868

commit_message:
Configure HAProxy to prevent 'Slow Loris' attacks

This change configures all HAProxy HTTP (Horizon and OpenStack APIs)
services with two new options:
 * The option http-buffer-request instructs HAProxy to wait for the
   whole DATA before forwarding it to a server.
 * The timeout http-request 10s option tells how much time HAProxy
   let to a client to send the whole POST.
Also, this change moves ssl-default-*-options to the main config.

Conflicts:
	deployment/puppet/cluster/manifests/haproxy.pp
	deployment/puppet/openstack/manifests/ha/aodh.pp
	deployment/puppet/openstack/manifests/ha/glance.pp
	deployment/puppet/openstack/manifests/ha/keystone.pp
	deployment/puppet/openstack/manifests/ha/radosgw.pp
	deployment/puppet/openstack/manifests/ha/swift.pp
	deployment/puppet/openstack/spec/classes/openstack_ha_glance_spec.rb
	deployment/puppet/openstack/spec/classes/openstack_ha_keystone_spec.rb
	tests/noop/spec/hosts/openstack-haproxy/openstack-haproxy-glance_spec.rb
	tests/noop/spec/hosts/openstack-haproxy/openstack-haproxy-horizon_spec.rb
	tests/noop/spec/hosts/openstack-haproxy/openstack-haproxy-keystone_spec.rb

Closes-Bug: #1594314
Cherry-pick from: 89fc291381e70a638805d7e541eb0e35d0fb76ce
Change-Id: I01a07e325bc5b9df8c1ce31cd5ac8e36eb5d5859
Signed-off-by: Maksim Malchuk <mmalchuk@mirantis.com>

commit_message:
[sync/mitaka] Set heat notification_driver only if ceilometer is enabled

We shouldn't send any notification messages into RabbitMQ
queue if ceilometer isn't enabled (so no one consumes them).

Change-Id: I1542df8664ae672a2325e7808636d875f71f1d9a
Related-bug: #1616135

commit_message:
Use proper IP address for rabbit management access

`host_ip` parameter is only used in OCF script, and it's used to
connect to management HTTP API - so using host to which rabbit binds
its AMQP listener makes completely no sense.

Change-Id: I029ef9c88f397de11da5ec5048e7314b92ddc441
Closes-Bug: 1668311

subject: Execute ssl-dns-setup task on all pre-defined tags
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2017-03-23 09:28:05.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/puppet/osnailyfacter/modular/ssl/tasks.yaml'], 'message': 'Execute ssl-dns-setup task on all pre-defined tags

As we have pre-defined tags inside fuel we should ensure
that all of tags are able to be deployed properly.
ssl-dns-setup task was skipped for all non-controller tags which
leads to not configured dns server on these nodes (and as result -
failed upload_cirros task).

Change-Id: I045bb7e709d6e18e2beb934b42094cbb4bc61f00
Closes-bug: 1665353
'}]
commit_message:
Execute ssl-dns-setup task on all pre-defined tags

As we have pre-defined tags inside fuel we should ensure
that all of tags are able to be deployed properly.
ssl-dns-setup task was skipped for all non-controller tags which
leads to not configured dns server on these nodes (and as result -
failed upload_cirros task).

Change-Id: I045bb7e709d6e18e2beb934b42094cbb4bc61f00
Closes-bug: 1665353

[{'number': 4, 'created': '2017-03-23 09:46:30.000000000', 'files': ['files/rabbit-fence/rabbit-fence.py'], 'message': "Make rabbit-fence more robust and portable

If Type=forking in systemd's service unit file, systemd requires started
application to fork a child process and exit. This change makes rabbit-fence
work under this situation. It does not has any negative effect on ubuntu's
/sbin/init, execept fork one more time. In a word, this change makes rabbit-fence

(cherry picked from commit 45ab46f288f5bdbe0ea7febc6e5157c2e81e0868)
"}]
commit_message:
Make rabbit-fence more robust and portable

If Type=forking in systemd's service unit file, systemd requires started
application to fork a child process and exit. This change makes rabbit-fence
work under this situation. It does not has any negative effect on ubuntu's
/sbin/init, execept fork one more time. In a word, this change makes rabbit-fence
more robust and portable in a very limited cost.

Change-Id: Ia0dfc204ba6879bd4252585a719c8ad9afac7daa
Closes-bug: #1633715
(cherry picked from commit 45ab46f288f5bdbe0ea7febc6e5157c2e81e0868)

ovs-vswitch daemon incorrecly doing serial stop -> start which affects
proper restart handling and remains with non-dpdk binary in runtime.
In order to mend the above issue make a restart action of daemon.

Change-Id: I61dbdb91f7fb9924bba4119993cb696eb0a7b9e9

'}]
commit_message:
Make ovs-vswitchd restart instead of stop/start

ovs-vswitch daemon incorrecly doing serial stop -> start which affects
proper restart handling and remains with non-dpdk binary in runtime.
In order to mend the above issue make a restart action of daemon.

Change-Id: I61dbdb91f7fb9924bba4119993cb696eb0a7b9e9
Closes-Bug: #1664862
(cherry picked from commit e0e195b1e65c8191fadb85b9eabed68ccb35e70d)

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 7109, 'name': 'Dmitry Mescheryakov (dmitryme)', 'email': 'dmescheryakov@mirantis.com', 'username': 'dmitryme'}, {'_account_id': 8786, 'name': 'Vladimir Kuklin', 'email': 'aglarendil@gmail.com', 'username': 'aglarendil'}, {'_account_id': 8971, 'name': 'Fuel CI', 'username': 'fuel-ci', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 11827, 'name': 'Stanislaw Bogatkin', 'email': 'regs+ubuntu.com@sbog.ru', 'username': 'sbogatkin'}, {'_account_id': 16771, 'name': 'mpolenchuk', 'email': 'mpolenchuk@mirantis.com', 'username': 'mpolenchuk'}, {'_account_id': 20656, 'name': 'Fuel Packaging CI', 'email': 'ci+fuel-packaging@mirantis.com', 'username': 'fuel-packaging-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-29 09:36:29.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/puppet/openstack/templates/02-ha.conf.erb', 'deployment/puppet/openstack/templates/10-fuel.conf.erb'], 'message': "Set up local logging for lrmd

Write lrmd logs to the /var/log/lrmd.log on controllers.

Also disabled collecting all pacemaker logs into /var/log/pacemaker.log
because Pacemaker already does that itself. In our installation rsyslog
does not write that file because in most cases Pacemaker creates it
first. For example, see the file's owner in any env, it will be
hacluster, not syslog.

Closes-Bug: #1661003
Change-Id: I0acb59a43bd856b1689918a7cf066624efa13a63
(cherry picked from commit 4d18ef0dadedb05e4876b42123a11a0121f5f708)
"}]
commit_message:
Set up local logging for lrmd

Write lrmd logs to the /var/log/lrmd.log on controllers.

Also disabled collecting all pacemaker logs into /var/log/pacemaker.log
because Pacemaker already does that itself. In our installation rsyslog
does not write that file because in most cases Pacemaker creates it
first. For example, see the file's owner in any env, it will be
hacluster, not syslog.

Closes-Bug: #1661003
Change-Id: I0acb59a43bd856b1689918a7cf066624efa13a63
(cherry picked from commit 4d18ef0dadedb05e4876b42123a11a0121f5f708)

Enable discard/fstrim option by default to optimize disk usage
with ceph backend. Also boolean option of storage:disk_discard

commit_message:
[ceph] Support discard/fstrim feature

Enable discard/fstrim option by default to optimize disk usage
with ceph backend. Also boolean option of storage:disk_discard
has been added to turn on/off this feature since it could bring
in some performance penalty on non-ssd disks.

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: #1682100
Change-Id: Ib2d582827f4f9bca2e0c7c1d3ebef7383194e6ab

commit_message:
Trust plugin-generated apt repos by default

We do not sign repositories for plugins as they are already
within a repository published by a plugin author and should
be signed there prior to installation on the master node.

Partial-bug: #1658989

Change-Id: I3b0a9766cd12dc2487c91340dbdc7b9e98f6fbf7

subject: Use wsgi for Cinder on MOS packages
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-05-11 09:10:40.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/puppet/openstack_tasks/manifests/openstack_cinder/openstack_cinder.pp'], 'message': "Use wsgi for Cinder on MOS packages

MOS Ocata packages don't contain startup unit for Cinder,
we need to use wsgi as frontend for Cinder when deploying with MOS 11
packages.

Change-Id: Iddc72930f2d8aea45d73101205c5af668645b1be
"}]
commit_message:
Use wsgi for Cinder on MOS packages

MOS Ocata packages don't contain startup unit for Cinder,
we need to use wsgi as frontend for Cinder when deploying with MOS 11
packages.

Change-Id: Iddc72930f2d8aea45d73101205c5af668645b1be

a result those changes affect library - so we need to update it too.

commit_message:
Retire repository

Fuel (from openstack namespace) and fuel-ccp (in x namespace)
repositories are unused and ready to retire.

This change removes all content from the repository and adds the usual
README file to point out that the repository is retired following the
process from
https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/drivers.html#retiring-a-project

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-December/011647.html

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/699362
Change-Id: I37b6a82c9c3c3893bb4b9b6a4c4b5a83a6d8193c

commit_message:
Remove logstash trusty job

Logstash is running on Xenial now, so remove the trusty job.
Make the xenial job voting.

Note that the Xenial job is passing, see https://review.opendev.org/690511 and
https://review.opendev.org/699561.

Change-Id: I88312aed871e61b7d715b775b6c741a09b81ea73

subject: [netconfig] Prefer ipv4 connections over ipv6
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 7468, 'name': 'Sergey Vasilenko', 'email': 'svasilenko@mirantis.com', 'username': 'xenolog'}, {'_account_id': 8967, 'name': 'Miroslav Anashkin', 'email': 'manashkin@mirantis.com', 'username': 'manashkin'}, {'_account_id': 8971, 'name': 'Fuel CI', 'username': 'fuel-ci', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9037, 'name': 'Dmitry Ilyin', 'email': 'idv1985@gmail.com', 'username': 'dilyin'}, {'_account_id': 11827, 'name': 'Stanislaw Bogatkin', 'email': 'regs+ubuntu.com@sbog.ru', 'username': 'sbogatkin'}, {'_account_id': 14200, 'name': 'Maksim Malchuk', 'email': 'maksim.malchuk@gmail.com', 'username': 'mmalchuk'}, {'_account_id': 16771, 'name': 'mpolenchuk', 'email': 'mpolenchuk@mirantis.com', 'username': 'mpolenchuk'}, {'_account_id': 20656, 'name': 'Fuel Packaging CI', 'email': 'ci+fuel-packaging@mirantis.com', 'username': 'fuel-packaging-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-05-12 07:48:52.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/puppet/osnailyfacter/manifests/netconfig/netconfig.pp'], 'message': "[netconfig] Prefer ipv4 connections over ipv6

Ubuntu prefers ipv6 connections therefore in some networks, this
breaks software updates (it does a AAAA DNS lookup before A record
lookups). Let's prefer old style ipv4 connections over the new ipv6 in
order to save some processing and resource utilization.

Change-Id: I315f56dabbaedd4298f99579a10444ff0c5d7778
Closes-Bug: #1687705
"}]
commit_message:
[netconfig] Prefer ipv4 connections over ipv6

Ubuntu prefers ipv6 connections therefore in some networks, this
breaks software updates (it does a AAAA DNS lookup before A record
lookups). Let's prefer old style ipv4 connections over the new ipv6 in
order to save some processing and resource utilization.

Change-Id: I315f56dabbaedd4298f99579a10444ff0c5d7778
Closes-Bug: #1687705

cpufrequtils performance governor and ondemand disable at boot

Disabling the ondemand  service in boot and make all the CPU to
performance state.

commit_message:
Set haproxy state to up when got 401 error

Haproxy state should be set to up, when got 401 code from client
side - Unauthorized - that means that backend is ready and up.

Change-Id: I65b6e6789ac376a2ba0c95f03f6963fed804ba2d
Closes-bug: #1597416
(cherry picked from commit 7e4afb7a6fe9a335ad0d7b66a6231da1c31599ef)

commit_message:
Create separate task for uploading Murano package

When we have enabled Glare for Murano, Core library package will
be uploaded to current Glance backend - Swift or RadosGW - hence
we must be sure that both already prepared and ready to use.

Also bump murano tag on 7.0.0-rc6, because of patch
I7c8d207d278bf6ce6cddbb9e1448303bf1f88eb6

Change-Id: If0a684aa9b0410e28a82b1501633c0ebdb64dc67
Closes-bug: #1572785
(cherry picked from commit e8dd56f5f8ac639ebfef95c151225bc408ed2be2)

commit_message:
Use default size for the MongoDB replication operation log

We should use default size for the replication operation log if the
value not defined in Hiera. On 64-bit systems, the 'oplog' is
typically 5% of available disk space.

Change-Id: Iafd5bc518f59e018b0e37410927e0e6f635ff0db
Closes-Bug: #1572957
Signed-off-by: Maksim Malchuk <mmalchuk@mirantis.com>
(cherry picked from commit 1bfdc6d08377f471f4e975f250d77179f8997bcd)

commit_message:
Upgrade a single package or a bunch of packages

It takes package names and versions from hiera hash to upgrade
and override "ensure" parameter in package resource.
If any package from the current puppet catalog is upgraded,
all the services in the same catalog should be restarted.

If there are no upgraded packages, then no services to be restarted.

Closes-Bug: #1623038
Related-Bug: #1616553

Change-Id: Id99bfae07ea0a9e63ad319076743a6101f2675f8

subject: Corrected default limits filter in nova API
revisions:

The old syntax that used % symbols, caused some errors upon a restart
of the nova-api. Replacing the % and parentheses with the double quotes

commit_message:
Corrected default limits filter in nova API

The old syntax that used % symbols, caused some errors upon a restart
of the nova-api. Replacing the % and parentheses with the double quotes
allows the API to start without errors.

Change-Id: I96c00590390c6caf0a17a43e68ede111684b3110
Closes-Bug: #1683496

commit_message:
Create Upstart-compatible state files for each interface

created by l23network in runtime.
This functionality required for correct 'ifdown' command work
first time without ifup (interface created by l23network runtime).

Change-Id: I05aecf2a69158f15eac636e33cedbdfbe817adc0
Closes-bug: #1674430

commit_message:
Remove node_name and hostname from allowed_hosts

Remove node_name and hostname from allowed_hosts for all task as we
already have '%'.
In 9.0 this has been done during blueprint:fuel-openstack-tasks so
it is simpler to make a new patch then cherry-pick.

Change-Id: Ib0e1aff0b6d7d0dd593c56b5af542c89cfacfc74
Closes-Bug: #1604476

subject: Send cluster id for pre provision task obviously
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-24 13:49:28.000000000', 'files': ['lib/astute/orchestrator.rb'], 'message': "Send cluster id for pre provision task obviously

Orchestrator implements a method called `calculate_cluster_id', which
extracts cluster id from the log file name that is supplied in the `cmd'
field of the parameters hash from pre_provision property of provisioning
info. We should get cluster id in a separate field (`cluster_id')
instead of inferring it from the string representation of the command
and fallback to the old scheme if the `cluster_id' parameter is missing.

Change-Id: I85aebca15c8f3cd7f12760883f2062b7338ed51c
Partial-Bug: #1449512
"}]
commit_message:
Send cluster id for pre provision task obviously

Orchestrator implements a method called `calculate_cluster_id', which
extracts cluster id from the log file name that is supplied in the `cmd'
field of the parameters hash from pre_provision property of provisioning
info. We should get cluster id in a separate field (`cluster_id')
instead of inferring it from the string representation of the command
and fallback to the old scheme if the `cluster_id' parameter is missing.

Change-Id: I85aebca15c8f3cd7f12760883f2062b7338ed51c
Partial-Bug: #1449512

subject: Fix encoding of shotgun stdout
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-11-03 12:54:06.000000000', 'files': ['lib/astute/dump.rb'], 'message': "Fix encoding of shotgun stdout

Mcollective uses sustemu module to execute shell commands. This module
doesn't care about encoding and as a result we get shotgun stdout as a
string with ASCII-8BIT encoding. Later we get a failure at the attempt
to encode it to JSON. However, shotgun output depends on locale settings
and is usually UTF-8.

Change-Id: I838f1aa55ea2885c1353a352c537dfe1bcd1e7e3
Closes-Bug: #1604311
"}]
commit_message:
Fix encoding of shotgun stdout

Mcollective uses sustemu module to execute shell commands. This module
doesn't care about encoding and as a result we get shotgun stdout as a
string with ASCII-8BIT encoding. Later we get a failure at the attempt
to encode it to JSON. However, shotgun output depends on locale settings
and is usually UTF-8.

Change-Id: I838f1aa55ea2885c1353a352c537dfe1bcd1e7e3
Closes-Bug: #1604311

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 7468, 'name': 'Sergey Vasilenko', 'email': 'svasilenko@mirantis.com', 'username': 'xenolog'}, {'_account_id': 8971, 'name': 'Fuel CI', 'username': 'fuel-ci', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 11827, 'name': 'Stanislaw Bogatkin', 'email': 'regs+ubuntu.com@sbog.ru', 'username': 'sbogatkin'}, {'_account_id': 20656, 'name': 'Fuel Packaging CI', 'email': 'ci+fuel-packaging@mirantis.com', 'username': 'fuel-packaging-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2017-05-04 13:12:34.000000000', 'files': ['files/fuel-ha-utils/ocf/ns_IPaddr2', 'deployment/puppet/l23network/spec/classes/l2_lnx_subinterfaces_into_ovs_bridge__spec.rb', 'deployment/puppet/l23network/lib/puppet/parser/functions/generate_network_config.rb'], 'message': 'Fix OVS-related issues with underlay networking

* more intelligent calculation of default port provider
* additional check of patchcord existing in the bridge

OVS provider should be used for fake (OVS) ports, inserted
into OVS bridge. OVS provider should be used for inserting
native linux interface into OVS bridge.

But if we try to add native linux subinterface into
OVS bridge we should use lnx provider for creating
such port correctly.

Change-Id: Ib76b3340eca1ea22095da1cfffe7c224a139fb71
Closes-bug: #1682835
'}]
commit_message:
Fix OVS-related issues with underlay networking

* more intelligent calculation of default port provider
* additional check of patchcord existing in the bridge

OVS provider should be used for fake (OVS) ports, inserted
into OVS bridge. OVS provider should be used for inserting
native linux interface into OVS bridge.

But if we try to add native linux subinterface into
OVS bridge we should use lnx provider for creating
such port correctly.

Change-Id: Ib76b3340eca1ea22095da1cfffe7c224a139fb71
Closes-bug: #1682835

commit_message:
cpufrequtils performance governor and ondemand disable at boot

Disabling the ondemand  service in boot and make all the CPU to
performance state..

Closes-Bug: #1641181
Change-Id: Ifefec9f46801066c6a2d11c403f18d1126c4f61f

commit_message:
Retire repository

Fuel (from openstack namespace) and fuel-ccp (in x namespace)
repositories are unused and ready to retire.

This change removes all content from the repository and adds the usual
README file to point out that the repository is retired following the

commit_message:
Retire repository

Fuel (from openstack namespace) and fuel-ccp (in x namespace)
repositories are unused and ready to retire.

This change removes all content from the repository and adds the usual
README file to point out that the repository is retired following the
process from
https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/drivers.html#retiring-a-project

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-December/011647.html

commit_message:
Trust plugin-generated apt repos by default

We do not sign repositories for plugins as they are already
within a repository published by a plugin author and should
be signed there prior to installation on the master node.

Partial-bug: #1658989

Change-Id: I3b0a9766cd12dc2487c91340dbdc7b9e98f6fbf7

Change-Id: I1083a0218045a4979ab7cd1956374b430bddf52c
'}]
commit_message:
Fix event_dispatcher usage in Ceilometer

We still use deprecated Ceilometer Event API in Newton. The default
value is removed in Ceilometer. It leads to failures during Ceilometer
notification agent process events.

Change-Id: I1083a0218045a4979ab7cd1956374b430bddf52c

commit_message:
Split out openstack-cinder task

openstack-cinder task has been splitted out to avoid race condition
when syncdb ain't completed (or even not started yet) on primary
controller before a cinder-api service start up on secondary ones.

Change-Id: Ic506ba6f5b5908a71eca52a077d8bd6084655dc6
Closes-Bug: #1681686
(cherry-picked from commit 402e66aca)

commit_message:
Refactor "plugins_rsync" to prevent failed syncs

Uses the "plugins-pull" shell script to sync the plugins. It should
work much more reliable then the previous Puppet based solution
and it allows operators to manually run this script at any moment

It also pulls plugins task.yaml files to the nodes. They will
be used later by the local Fuel task launcher.

Change-Id: I0a1623235da7163c4bb53bd19c1e2e3e03019026

It takes package names and versions from hiera hash to upgrade
and override "ensure" parameter in package resource.
If any package from the current puppet catalog is upgraded,
all the services in the same catalog should be restarted.

If there are no upgraded packages, then no services to be restarted.

Change-Id: Ic3455c54aeea8890f8f3454c269d5f8a8ea0de4e
Closes-Bug: #1623038
Related-Bug: #1616553
'}]
commit_message:
[sync/mitaka] Upgrade a single package or a bunch of packages

It takes package names and versions from hiera hash to upgrade
and override "ensure" parameter in package resource.
If any package from the current puppet catalog is upgraded,
all the services in the same catalog should be restarted.

If there are no upgraded packages, then no services to be restarted.

Change-Id: Ic3455c54aeea8890f8f3454c269d5f8a8ea0de4e
Closes-Bug: #1623038
Related-Bug: #1616553

commit_message:
Retire repository

Fuel (from openstack namespace) and fuel-ccp (in x namespace)
repositories are unused and ready to retire.

This change removes all content from the repository and adds the usual
README file to point out that the repository is retired following the
process from
https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/drivers.html#retiring-a-project

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-December/011647.html

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/699362
Change-Id: Iffe3a7de281b48693606fe0c84ebec8190018167

commit_message:
Configuration drive format parameter includes invalid option

The config_drive_format parameter example includes an extra value which
causes the deployment environment to not be set correctly in nova.conf.

Closes-bug: #1665976

In fuel-agent.log, mountpoint -q /tmp/target/sys/fs/fuse/connections
execute failed.

Fuse is a kernel mechanism, it has a fixed pseudo filesystem
location (/sys/fs/fuse/connection) for user. We do not
need to umount it manually, let kernel take care of that.
In our case, nobody cares about fuse in kernel by
/sys/fs/fuse/connection. So we don't need to mount and umount
in chroot.

commit_message:
Fix umount fuse control filesystem error

In fuel-agent.log, mountpoint -q /tmp/target/sys/fs/fuse/connections
execute failed.

Fuse is a kernel mechanism, it has a fixed pseudo filesystem
location (/sys/fs/fuse/connection) for user. We do not
need to umount it manually, let kernel take care of that.
In our case, nobody cares about fuse in kernel by
/sys/fs/fuse/connection. So we don't need to mount and umount
in chroot.

https://www.kernel.org/doc/Documentation/filesystems/fuse.txt

Change-Id: I0a9af904b2b65af1af96340c0579dedf979464fc
(cherry picked from commit 01d7633e8775dcc4bb25bdf8d4e0add5060e1878)

commit_message:
Fix umount fuse control filesystem error

In fuel-agent.log, mountpoint -q /tmp/target/sys/fs/fuse/connections
execute failed.

Fuse is a kernel mechanism, it has a fixed pseudo filesystem
location (/sys/fs/fuse/connection) for user. We do not
need to umount it manually, let kernel take care of that.
In our case, nobody cares about fuse in kernel by
/sys/fs/fuse/connection. So we don't need to mount and umount
in chroot.

https://www.kernel.org/doc/Documentation/filesystems/fuse.txt

Change-Id: I0a9af904b2b65af1af96340c0579dedf979464fc
(cherry picked from commit 01d7633e8775dcc4bb25bdf8d4e0add5060e1878)

commit_message:
Retire repository

Fuel (from openstack namespace) and fuel-ccp (in x namespace)
repositories are unused and ready to retire.

This change removes all content from the repository and adds the usual
README file to point out that the repository is retired following the
process from
https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/drivers.html#retiring-a-project

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-December/011647.html

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/699362
Change-Id: I658efd028f1b23bc21b327fc55d39a7fa5824ec1

commit_message:
Retire repository

Fuel (from openstack namespace) and fuel-ccp (in x namespace)
repositories are unused and ready to retire.

This change removes all content from the repository and adds the usual
README file to point out that the repository is retired following the
process from
https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/drivers.html#retiring-a-project

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-December/011647.html

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/699362
Change-Id: Icc6a810696788e65e9afd8be691400d4d39de313

commit_message:
Retire repository

Fuel (from openstack namespace) and fuel-ccp (in x namespace)
repositories are unused and ready to retire.

This change removes all content from the repository and adds the usual
README file to point out that the repository is retired following the
process from
https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/drivers.html#retiring-a-project

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-December/011647.html

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/699362
Change-Id: I11b06516aa9d24b8defbb85d504ee5a90d10f2a6

commit_message:
Retire repository

Fuel (from openstack namespace) and fuel-ccp (in x namespace)
repositories are unused and ready to retire.

This change removes all content from the repository and adds the usual
README file to point out that the repository is retired following the
process from
https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/drivers.html#retiring-a-project

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-December/011647.html

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/699362
Change-Id: I10917e42829b459c41ca46514faa72fc46abf7be

commit_message:
Retire repository

Fuel (from openstack namespace) and fuel-ccp (in x namespace)
repositories are unused and ready to retire.

This change removes all content from the repository and adds the usual
README file to point out that the repository is retired following the
process from
https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/drivers.html#retiring-a-project

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-December/011647.html

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/699362
Change-Id: I3ed5ff99845dc94e0b531dadfa20fda9eb1cc848

commit_message:
Use python2.7 when running nailgun via tox

Web.py doesn't support tox, so commands like
tox -e start,stop,performace will try to use
python3 and fail. Let only pep8 test will use
python3.

Closes-Bug: #1616941

Change-Id: Ia478d2f8c3d11161076a261500e96d2ee9010bcb

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 3009, 'name': 'Vladimir Kozhukalov', 'email': 'kozhukalov@gmail.com', 'username': 'kozhukalov'}, {'_account_id': 8003, 'name': 'Aleksandr Gordeev', 'email': 'agordeev@mirantis.com', 'username': 'agordeev'}, {'_account_id': 8971, 'name': 'Fuel CI', 'username': 'fuel-ci', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10288, 'name': 'Aleksey', 'email': 'alexz.kh.ua@gmail.com', 'username': 'alexz'}, {'_account_id': 10488, 'name': 'Artur Svechnikov', 'email': 'asvechnikov@mirantis.com', 'username': 'asvechnikov'}, {'_account_id': 12275, 'name': 'Albert Syriy', 'email': 'asyriy@mirantis.com', 'username': 'asyriy'}, {'_account_id': 12953, 'name': 'Nikita Koshikov', 'email': 'nkoshikov@mirantis.com', 'username': 'nkoshikov'}, {'_account_id': 14200, 'name': 'Maksim Malchuk', 'email': 'maksim.malchuk@gmail.com', 'username': 'mmalchuk'}, {'_account_id': 14525, 'name': 'Vasyl Saienko', 'email': 'vsaienko@mirantis.com', 'username': 'vsaienko'}, {'_account_id': 20656, 'name': 'Fuel Packaging CI', 'email': 'ci+fuel-packaging@mirantis.com', 'username': 'fuel-packaging-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23156, 'name': 'Peter Turi', 'email': 'peter.turi@ericsson.com'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2016-08-16 15:50:42.000000000', 'files': ['fuel_agent/tests/test_manager.py', 'fuel_agent/manager.py'], 'message': "Include udev rules for NIC mappings into initramfs

Sometimes, udev can't resolve NIC renamings according to
the its rules. Especially when there're a bunch of NICs
and one of them has been used for PXE booting.
Udev stuggles with late renamings when a system is actually up
and network services are already running too. In the result,
admin NIC gets its temporary name like renamedX.

Moving udev rules into initramfs, thorouhgly allows udev to rename
NIC without any flaws. Since nobody uses NIC during early initramfs
running time that practically means nothing will prevent the
completion of NIC renaming.

Change-Id: I9f87833e7d4c864913b7e6113d416614493b23f7
Closes-Bug: #1583815
"}]
commit_message:
Include udev rules for NIC mappings into initramfs

Sometimes, udev can't resolve NIC renamings according to
the its rules. Especially when there're a bunch of NICs
and one of them has been used for PXE booting.
Udev stuggles with late renamings when a system is actually up
and network services are already running too. In the result,
admin NIC gets its temporary name like renamedX.

Moving udev rules into initramfs, thorouhgly allows udev to rename
NIC without any flaws. Since nobody uses NIC during early initramfs
running time that practically means nothing will prevent the
completion of NIC renaming.

Change-Id: I9f87833e7d4c864913b7e6113d416614493b23f7
Closes-Bug: #1583815

commit_message:
Don't ignore failure to load extensions

When an extension fails to load a message will be logged along with
the exception raised by the extension. The exception will be
re-raised.

Change-Id: Ic8e8931a34f59102dbcd1f5c5dc48d562cabedff
Closes-bug: #1555005
(cherry picked from commit b20d67712e6815f709b0ab80f393e1c2303906d1)

commit_message:
fix prepare_for_deployment function

If we pass not all nodes as a parameter to prepare_for_deployment
function there will be an exception, because this functions expected all
nodes. This patch fixes this and you can freely pass subset of nodes as
a parameter

Change-Id: Ib0a422db7011f2e5f2d1793e295654bfded8a557
Related-Bug: #1619162

commit_message:
Align nailgun docs building with OS-Infra

This is a first step in moving Nailgun API docs building and publishing
to upstream infra. To enable gate-fuel-web-docs job docs should be able
to be built with 'tox -evenv -- python setup.py build_sphinx' command and
html output should be available in doc/build/html directory.

Change-Id: I42eb69a4060f50c8ef99cef4d54577078c1c846c
(cherry picked from commit 4d8a2f29bf21159ac6a80533aba8e4b38c2cc720)

Currentry cleanup_server() helper function kills all the
processes who use NAILGUN_PORT - not only listening to it,
but also establishing connections to it - like browsers.
This commit makes this functions kill only processes that are
only listening to this port.

Change-Id: I947be9e0dbf0e3aa7f677787ce85b775eef14934
(cherry picked from commit 3dcb3c3f6978bdeda18d7ca8b557a8d05ff7bdba)
'}]
commit_message:
Do not kill other processes on nailgun server cleanup

Currentry cleanup_server() helper function kills all the
processes who use NAILGUN_PORT - not only listening to it,
but also establishing connections to it - like browsers.
This commit makes this functions kill only processes that are
only listening to this port.

Change-Id: I947be9e0dbf0e3aa7f677787ce85b775eef14934
(cherry picked from commit 3dcb3c3f6978bdeda18d7ca8b557a8d05ff7bdba)

now redundant with their parent functional target
which is now using basepython=python3 so just running
tox -efunctional will run with whatever python3 environment
is on the host, e.g. py36 on standard ubuntu bionic:

  $ python3 --version
  Python 3.6.8

Change-Id: Ibb679e0cffa18291b91f10b19559d2a68e986486
'}]
commit_message:
Remove redundant functional-py3* tox environments

The functional-py36 and functional-py37 targets are
now redundant with their parent functional target
which is now using basepython=python3 so just running
tox -efunctional will run with whatever python3 environment
is on the host, e.g. py36 on standard ubuntu bionic:

  $ python3 --version
  Python 3.6.8

Change-Id: Ibb679e0cffa18291b91f10b19559d2a68e986486

fuel-octane already uses PBR:-

	pbr=True)

commit_message:
Drop MANIFEST.in - it's not needed by pbr

fuel-octane already uses PBR:-
setuptools.setup(
	setup_requires=['pbr>=1.8'],
	pbr=True)

This patch removes `MANIFEST.in` file as pbr generates a
sensible manifest from git files and some standard files
and it removes the need for an explicit `MANIFEST.in` file.

Change-Id: Icd48bda4bcf91f40c976a68ff8feff57f85e02c5

commit_message:
Replaces yaml.load() with yaml.safe_load()

Yaml.load() return Python object may be dangerous if you receive
a YAML document from an untrusted source such as the Internet.
The function yaml.safe_load() limits this ability to simple Python
objects like integers or lists.

Reference:
https://security.openstack.org/guidelines/dg_avoid-dangerous-input-parsing-libraries.html

Change-Id: I81cde12b2b9bf63e6af35c38de5eee6e67440594

commit_message:
Retire repository

Fuel (from openstack namespace) and fuel-ccp (in x namespace)
repositories are unused and ready to retire.

This change removes all content from the repository and adds the usual
README file to point out that the repository is retired following the
process from
https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/drivers.html#retiring-a-project

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-December/011647.html

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/699362
Change-Id: I05e9dc69ed58c70c50d5c6d065ba60b244c5c9d2

subject: Ensure option groups don't change during logging
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-12-18 00:52:35.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_config/cfg.py'], 'message': "Ensure option groups don't change during logging

oslo.config allows us to configure groups and options dynamically. This
can cause a race with our logging as we attempt to iterate through
option groups that are changing under our feet. This wouldn't be a huge
issue, since these are just logs are we can always log again, if needed,
but we store groups in a dictionary and Python doesn't like us changing
the size of a dict it's iterating through:

  RuntimeError: dictionary changed size during iteration

Given that we're only reading through this option group and don't need
to worry about a group _disappearing_, the solution is pretty simple:
create a copy of our option group names ahead of time so we don't need
to worry about new ones coming and messing things up.

No tests are included since this is a race and the only way I see to
reproduce this would involve lots of ugly threading.

Change-Id: Id3b28465d645a24f0fcebff2dd68a9bd30e21594
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1856312
(cherry picked from commit e3e2ba55eeeb86a9bc0624bb2592e46583e839e7)
"}]
commit_message:
Ensure option groups don't change during logging

oslo.config allows us to configure groups and options dynamically. This
can cause a race with our logging as we attempt to iterate through
option groups that are changing under our feet. This wouldn't be a huge
issue, since these are just logs are we can always log again, if needed,
but we store groups in a dictionary and Python doesn't like us changing
the size of a dict it's iterating through:

  RuntimeError: dictionary changed size during iteration

Given that we're only reading through this option group and don't need
to worry about a group _disappearing_, the solution is pretty simple:
create a copy of our option group names ahead of time so we don't need
to worry about new ones coming and messing things up.

No tests are included since this is a race and the only way I see to
reproduce this would involve lots of ugly threading.

Change-Id: Id3b28465d645a24f0fcebff2dd68a9bd30e21594
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1856312
(cherry picked from commit e3e2ba55eeeb86a9bc0624bb2592e46583e839e7)

commit_message:
Retire repository

Fuel (from openstack namespace) and fuel-ccp (in x namespace)
repositories are unused and ready to retire.

This change removes all content from the repository and adds the usual
README file to point out that the repository is retired following the
process from
https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/drivers.html#retiring-a-project

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-December/011647.html

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/699362
Change-Id: I9c48f2cfa39e04a629e20cb320caca8fd69758fd

commit_message:
use input() instead of raw_input()

raw_input() renamed to input() in python 3
so let's import it from six module.

Closes-Bug: #1597810
(cherry picked from commit 80202eb7a8951d5dddae9ba3cf3d648d30abf7b8)

commit_message:
Split nailgun api log

Node information from nailgun agent should be in
separate log to increase rotate time for main api log.
That patch allow to define separte logs based on uri regexp.

Change-Id: If05f324bb40a473f0ada23a9e18fd7295b46ec9f
Partial-Bug: #1393148

[{'number': 6, 'created': '2017-01-27 12:55:16.000000000', 'files': ['nailgun/nailgun/api/v1/handlers/node.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/test/integration/test_node_collection_handlers.py'], 'message': "Update node data only for specified node statuses

When node is provisioning, deploying or removing we shouldn't update
node data. Repeatable updates causes deadlock when ShareLock is not
granted in the other transaction due to locks of the DB keys. So in
case of locking task, cluster, node in receiver and repeatable updates
of node in the API handler we had a deadlock.

Change-Id: I7addd5a9e256403df91e818d0efcefc347989789
Partial-Bug: #1624230
"}]
commit_message:
Update node data only for specified node statuses

When node is provisioning, deploying or removing we shouldn't update
node data. Repeatable updates causes deadlock when ShareLock is not
granted in the other transaction due to locks of the DB keys. So in
case of locking task, cluster, node in receiver and repeatable updates
of node in the API handler we had a deadlock.

Change-Id: I7addd5a9e256403df91e818d0efcefc347989789
Partial-Bug: #1624230

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2017-02-06 07:56:28.000000000', 'files': ['fuelweb_test/models/fuel_web_client.py'], 'message': 'Fix template network settings retrieval

Fuel-qa would not load these settings from a template:
    - ip_range setting for storage and management networks;
    - cidr and gateway settings for private network.

This commit fixes the issue.

Change-Id: I69a6ffa4027cac0b63c56069daeb7c0dcc27ba04

commit_message:
Fix template network settings retrieval

Fuel-qa would not load these settings from a template:
    - ip_range setting for storage and management networks;
    - cidr and gateway settings for private network.

This commit fixes the issue.

Change-Id: I69a6ffa4027cac0b63c56069daeb7c0dcc27ba04

commit_message:
Use haproxy_restart class instead of service restarting

As we already have special class for haproxy restart, leverage it
instead of trying to restart by 'service' resource.

Change-Id: I0f202f499dbb29dd9408591dc0906ab1a347719f
Closes-Bug: #1661177

commit_message:
use separate wsgi scripts for admin and public keystone endpoints

keystone.wsgi is deprecated in Mitaka. Separate generated scripts
for public and admin endpoints should be used instead as per [1].
Both scripts are bundled in MOS and RDO keystone package and default
location is used: /usr/bin/keystone-wsgi-admin|public.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/puppet-keystone/+bug/1558290

Closes-Bug: #1636834
Change-Id: I262a18a539ab8f05d18f6ecd412bf0eb5b7de6b7
Signed-off-by: Pavel Glushchak <pglushchak@virtuozzo.com>
(cherry picked from commit ab73b5726e6692f67e578252bf2678a6b9b537e0)

revisions:
[{'number': 15, 'created': '2016-09-19 12:58:17.000000000', 'files': ['nailgun/nailgun/extensions/volume_manager/tests/test_pipelines.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/extensions/volume_manager/manager.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/fixtures/openstack.yaml', 'nailgun/nailgun/extensions/volume_manager/tests/test_node_disks.py'], 'message': 'Changing filesystems structure.

Separating number of directories into standalone filesystems.
/home:
Ensuring that /home is mounted on its own partition enables the setting
of more restrictive mount options, and also helps ensure that users
cannot trivially fill partitions used for log or audit data storage.

/var/log/audit:
Placing /var/log/audit in its own partition enables better separation
between audit files and other files, and helps ensure that auditing
cannot be halted due to the partition running out of space.

/var:
Ensuring that /var is mounted on its own partition enables the setting
of more restrictive mount options. This helps protect system services
such as daemons or other programs which use it. It is not uncommon for
the /var directory to contain world-writable directories installed by
other software packages.

/tmp:
The /tmp partition is used as temporary storage by many programs.
Placing /tmp in its own partition enables the setting of more
restrictive mount options, which can help protect programs which use it.

UPDATE:
adding seperated generators for each fs as it caused most issues with
test units
changing size of volume
adding LVs setups to test_pipelines.py

docimpact
Closes-Bug: #1526329
Change-Id: I18f25208616b52a019dd9959c040d3d8685a4aed
'}]
commit_message:
Changing filesystems structure.

Separating number of directories into standalone filesystems.
/home:
Ensuring that /home is mounted on its own partition enables the setting
of more restrictive mount options, and also helps ensure that users
cannot trivially fill partitions used for log or audit data storage.

/var/log/audit:
Placing /var/log/audit in its own partition enables better separation
between audit files and other files, and helps ensure that auditing
cannot be halted due to the partition running out of space.

/var:
Ensuring that /var is mounted on its own partition enables the setting
of more restrictive mount options. This helps protect system services
such as daemons or other programs which use it. It is not uncommon for
the /var directory to contain world-writable directories installed by
other software packages.

/tmp:
The /tmp partition is used as temporary storage by many programs.
Placing /tmp in its own partition enables the setting of more
restrictive mount options, which can help protect programs which use it.

UPDATE:
adding seperated generators for each fs as it caused most issues with
test units
changing size of volume
adding LVs setups to test_pipelines.py

docimpact
Closes-Bug: #1526329
Change-Id: I18f25208616b52a019dd9959c040d3d8685a4aed

commit_message:
fix prepare_for_deployment function

If we pass not all nodes as a parameter to prepare_for_deployment
function there will be an exception, because this functions expected all
nodes. This patch fixes this and you can freely pass subset of nodes as
a parameter

Change-Id: Ib0a422db7011f2e5f2d1793e295654bfded8a557
Related-Bug: #1619162

commit_message:
Add the possibility to tune xinetd/tftpd server on Fuel master

This is a workaround for hanging tftpd processes.
The root cause can't be solved in Fuel, but this patch should ease
the load on the Fuel master.

The tftpd server is now started with an timeout option of 30 seconds
instead of the default 900 seconds.

The performance affecting parameters of xinetd & tftpd can be configured from
Fuel astute.yaml. The parameters are:
server_args : all options can be set for tftpd, '$args' as last asrgument
per_source  : This specifies the maximum instances of this service
              per source IP address (xinetd)
cps         : Limits the rate of incoming connections (xinetd)
This opens the possibility to have different parameters for different
size of environments.

Default configuration is equal to current, plus the timeout.

Change-Id: I00277b4e35e038edb36fe4f9c622e09723b675a5
Closes-bug: #1625716

commit_message:
Add packages update features

* package_versions function can update the ensure
  values of the packages in the catalog.

* update_packages meta-type can update packages in the
  catalog or packages already installed at the target system.

* [disabled] package override type can make a Hiera lookup for
  every package resource to get the version to install.

* move apt_fuel package provider from osnailyfacter to
  this modules because it belongs here.

Change-Id: Ia5c48436c2ea9c3c846a7a5c765f97d592f913f0
Related-Bug: 1612805

commit_message:
[ceph] Employ radosgw built-in frontend

As of firefly (v0.80), ceph object gateway is running on civetweb
(embedded into the ceph-radosgw daemon) instead of apache and fastcgi.
Using civetweb simplifies the ceph object gateway installation and
configuration.

Change-Id: Idba61e094390e3c75a6e5d9b35a8e8e47a2a696f
Closes-Bug: #1671808
Closes-Bug: #1688267
(cherry picked from commit d38e1a399cb0793690781d95f688ce7061f9072d)

subject: Add more strict checking for veth pair into OVS bridge.
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-05-31 11:36:52.000000000', 'files': ['files/fuel-ha-utils/ocf/ns_IPaddr2'], 'message': "Add more strict checking for veth pair into OVS bridge.

Some time VETH pair may be self-disassempled or broken by 3d party action,
but OVS doesn't know about it and does not remove port with broken interface.
Such ports we can detect by 'ifindex' property. For really existing interfaces
'ifindex' property should be equal to real ifindex. For broken interfaces
'ifindex' mabe have zero or empty value.

This patchset add checking for it.

Also:
 * improove logging
 * monitor() function was refactored, because previous logic had no full
   coverage of failure cases.
 * set sysctl -w net.ipv4.ip_nonlocal_bind=1 into network namespace while creating

Change-Id: I05062f84895e020b10a94ac09f8573598434b0e6
Closes-Bug: #1682835
"}]
commit_message:
Add more strict checking for veth pair into OVS bridge.

Some time VETH pair may be self-disassempled or broken by 3d party action,
but OVS doesn't know about it and does not remove port with broken interface.
Such ports we can detect by 'ifindex' property. For really existing interfaces
'ifindex' property should be equal to real ifindex. For broken interfaces
'ifindex' mabe have zero or empty value.

This patchset add checking for it.

Also:
 * improove logging
 * monitor() function was refactored, because previous logic had no full
   coverage of failure cases.
 * set sysctl -w net.ipv4.ip_nonlocal_bind=1 into network namespace while creating

Change-Id: I05062f84895e020b10a94ac09f8573598434b0e6
Closes-Bug: #1682835

 * set sysctl -w net.ipv4.ip_nonlocal_bind=1 into network namespace while creating

Change-Id: I05062f84895e020b10a94ac09f8573598434b0e6
Closes-Bug: #1682835
"}]
commit_message:
Add more strict checking for veth pair into OVS bridge.

Some time VETH pair may be self-disassempled or broken by 3d party action,
but OVS doesn't know about it and does not remove port with broken interface.
Such ports we can detect by 'ifindex' property. For really existing interfaces
'ifindex' property should be equal to real ifindex. For broken interfaces
'ifindex' mabe have zero or empty value.

This patchset add checking for it.

Also:
 * improove logging
 * monitor() function was refactored, because previous logic had no full
   coverage of failure cases.
 * set sysctl -w net.ipv4.ip_nonlocal_bind=1 into network namespace while creating

Change-Id: I05062f84895e020b10a94ac09f8573598434b0e6
Closes-Bug: #1682835

commit_message:
Fetch unread notifications number

Replace 20sec polling of the whole notification collection
by polling of notification statistics (GET /api/notifications/stats)
which includes number of unread notifications.
This number is rendered in notifications badge in Fuel UI.

Also, notifications are marked as read by a new handler
PUT /api/notifications/change_status with {status: 'read'} payload.

Partial-Bug: #1657348

Depends-On: I2e6a0daaf8712ab3064df728a8fb463ef805aa06

Change-Id: I6a7eae7abf2b43143039db7ca262ae40ce5a30b4

commit_message:
Fix html_last_updated_fmt for Python3

Fix the Sphinx html_last_updated_fmt for Python3. The
html_last_updated_fmt option is interpreted as a byte
string in python3, causing Sphinx build to break.
This patch makes it utf-8 string.

Change-Id: I8d47b0ab690fd682c4e72b742b68b7bf9201557a

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-06-07 14:36:16.000000000', 'files': ['nailgun/nailgun/test/unit/test_handlers.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/objects/base.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/api/v1/handlers/base.py'], 'message': 'Add limit, offset, order in collection GET

Allow limiting the number of objects returned via GET
by providing "limit"
Example: api/notifications?limit=5

Allow offseting (skipping N first records) via "offset"
Example: api/notifications?offset=100

Allow ordering of objects by providing "order_by"
Example: api/notifications?order_by=-id

Add helper functions/classes to:
- get HTTP parameters (limit, offset, order_by)
- get scoped collection query by applying 4 operations
  filter, order, offset, limit
- set Conent-Range header if scope limits are present

Make default NailgunCollection's GET utilize scoped query
This makes default (parent) GET of child handlers support paging
and ordering (overriden GET methods will not get this functionality
automatically)
NailgunCollection.GET is also an example of how to implement
this new functionality.

Helper functions/classes can be utilized in child handler methods
to implement filters / ordering / paging

Related-Bug: 1657348
Change-Id: I7760465f70b3f69791e7a0c558a26e8ba55c934a
(cherry picked from commit 03aaca2deeb062e962a81d16c2a75fb5fccfc265)
'}]
commit_message:
Add limit, offset, order in collection GET

Allow limiting the number of objects returned via GET
by providing "limit"
Example: api/notifications?limit=5

Allow offseting (skipping N first records) via "offset"
Example: api/notifications?offset=100

Allow ordering of objects by providing "order_by"
Example: api/notifications?order_by=-id

Add helper functions/classes to:
- get HTTP parameters (limit, offset, order_by)
- get scoped collection query by applying 4 operations
  filter, order, offset, limit
- set Conent-Range header if scope limits are present

Make default NailgunCollection's GET utilize scoped query
This makes default (parent) GET of child handlers support paging
and ordering (overriden GET methods will not get this functionality
automatically)
NailgunCollection.GET is also an example of how to implement
this new functionality.

Helper functions/classes can be utilized in child handler methods
to implement filters / ordering / paging

Related-Bug: 1657348
Change-Id: I7760465f70b3f69791e7a0c558a26e8ba55c934a
(cherry picked from commit 03aaca2deeb062e962a81d16c2a75fb5fccfc265)

commit_message:
Add 'Container' field for MD parser

The logic of filtering of fake RAID MD heavily relies on the
presence of of 'Container' field inside of parsed data.
If this field is missing, it will never figure out the name of any
fake RAID devices and its component.

This patch adds this field to a parser.

In addition to that, it also logs all found fake RAIDs and
their components for the sake of easy debugging.

Change-Id: I2066c5a0e995e542271cd308c9d83e2373787be4
Closes-Bug: #1617071
(cherry picked from commit 60173537665464db260fb93829eb8affced33535)

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-06-26 11:21:14.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/puppet/openstack/templates/openrc.erb'], 'message': 'Don't override LC_ALL

In Ubuntu (14.04) LC_ALL is not set by default,
other variables are set with UTF-8. Such combi-
nation of settings is valid for working with
non-ASCII characters.
Setting LC_ALL to "C" will override all other
LC_* settings and force ASCII usage. This obstructs
the work with Unicode variables in OSC arguments
(e.g. command 'glance image-create --name 試験画像'
will fail)
As OS works with UTF-8, so we shouldn't hinder.

Change-Id: I9ba428ac4e70cf7d7309054ccb63a46d496a8b4c
Closes-bug: #1543102
(cherry picked from commit 738a804960b8276e85eebd1fd3e37ba8212de122)

commit_message:
Don't override LC_ALL

In Ubuntu (14.04) LC_ALL is not set by default,
other variables are set with UTF-8. Such combi-
nation of settings is valid for working with
non-ASCII characters.
Setting LC_ALL to "C" will override all other
LC_* settings and force ASCII usage. This obstructs
the work with Unicode variables in OSC arguments
(e.g. command 'glance image-create --name 試験画像'
will fail)
As OS works with UTF-8, so we shouldn't hinder.

Change-Id: I9ba428ac4e70cf7d7309054ccb63a46d496a8b4c
Closes-bug: #1543102
(cherry picked from commit 738a804960b8276e85eebd1fd3e37ba8212de122)

commit_message:
Disable docker services when destroy containers.

Services docker-<containername> should be disabled when
there are no containers. That privents from issues
during restart (it's needed for upgrade).
That commit add container auto disable after destroy
and auto enable after start to dockerctl.

Change-Id: Id8778ff539bfc9a7f86ddadded446e0fd730e9a3
Closes-Bug: #1659823

subject: Add more checks to OCF scripts
revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2017-07-20 14:58:44.000000000', 'files': ['files/fuel-ha-utils/ocf/ns_IPaddr2', 'files/fuel-ha-utils/ocf/ns_haproxy'], 'message': 'Add more checks to OCF scripts

This commit introduces new health checks in OCF scripts.
ns_haproxy:
        Added checking responsiveness by reading from the stats socket
        which listens by default on the management VIP. This check works
        only on the node which has the management VIP at the moment.
        Misc: fix bash comprehension
ns_IPAddr2:
        Added a ping check to make sure we have working L3+
        connectivity.

Although this conditions are extremely rare to occur it would be better
to check resources more deeply.

Co-Authored-By: Alexey Zvyagintsev <azvyagintsev@mirantis.com>

Change-Id: I92b6ab06f13b47740e417c8780254daa07799b77
Closes-Bug: #1704657
'}]
commit_message:
Add more checks to OCF scripts

This commit introduces new health checks in OCF scripts.
ns_haproxy:
        Added checking responsiveness by reading from the stats socket
        which listens by default on the management VIP. This check works
        only on the node which has the management VIP at the moment.
        Misc: fix bash comprehension
ns_IPAddr2:
        Added a ping check to make sure we have working L3+
        connectivity.

Although this conditions are extremely rare to occur it would be better
to check resources more deeply.

Co-Authored-By: Alexey Zvyagintsev <azvyagintsev@mirantis.com>

Change-Id: I92b6ab06f13b47740e417c8780254daa07799b77
Closes-Bug: #1704657

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-07-20 12:25:35.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/puppet/osnailyfacter/manifests/openstack_haproxy/openstack_haproxy_swift.pp', 'deployment/puppet/openstack_tasks/examples/swift/tasks.yaml', 'deployment/puppet/osnailyfacter/manifests/openstack_haproxy/openstack_haproxy_radosgw.pp'], 'message': "Correct logical expressions for storage backends

After introducing the change Iead5167210c4132badb866afc25d4ef14e27f6b2
swift isn't installed if ceph used as a backend for images
and not for object-storage service. In this sutiation we end up
with absence of object-storage at all which is wrong.

The commit introduces changes which makes possible
to swift been installed if ceph used only for image service.

Change-Id: If319845aa9f2d9b3ca07936350ef374f504679cb
Closes-Bug: #1604879
"}]
commit_message:
Correct logical expressions for storage backends

After introducing the change Iead5167210c4132badb866afc25d4ef14e27f6b2
swift isn't installed if ceph used as a backend for images
and not for object-storage service. In this sutiation we end up
with absence of object-storage at all which is wrong.

The commit introduces changes which makes possible
to swift been installed if ceph used only for image service.

Change-Id: If319845aa9f2d9b3ca07936350ef374f504679cb
Closes-Bug: #1604879

commit_message:
fixed grub2 config path guessing on rhel7

Currently fuel-agent installs grub2 config in invalid
location for rhel7. Thus provisioned node cannot boot.
This problem can be fixed by re-ordering paths in
guess_grub2_conf() method. Also this change makes
grub version determination more generic.

Closes-Bug: #1627794
Change-Id: Ide299fd7b5045fa6383eb5e12f2b9597431349e8
Signed-off-by: Pavel Glushchak <pglushchak@virtuozzo.com>

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-12-08 06:54:57.000000000', 'files': ['fuelclient/tests/unit/v2/cli/test_deployment_graph.py', 'fuelclient/commands/graph.py'], 'message': "Make graph download command more predictable

Now if we try to download graph with any task level parameters
without specifying any filename the result (by default) will be
stored in 'cluster_graph.yaml'.
This patch:
  * makes default filename more accurate based on input parameters
    (environment id, task level graph value and format)
  * adds support to download graph in JSON format

  fuel2 graph download [-h] -e ENV (-a | -c | -p | -r)
                       [-t GRAPH_TYPE][-f FILE]
                       [--format {json,yaml}]

DocImpact

Change-Id: Ia7aa03cbbcde3d63e4ade5e76ea1242a2939b71e
(cherry picked from commit 13acdfba3727728451640c77fa40538ca615949d)
"}]
commit_message:
Make graph download command more predictable

Now if we try to download graph with any task level parameters
without specifying any filename the result (by default) will be
stored in 'cluster_graph.yaml'.
This patch:
  * makes default filename more accurate based on input parameters
    (environment id, task level graph value and format)
  * adds support to download graph in JSON format

  fuel2 graph download [-h] -e ENV (-a | -c | -p | -r)
                       [-t GRAPH_TYPE][-f FILE]
                       [--format {json,yaml}]

DocImpact

Change-Id: Ia7aa03cbbcde3d63e4ade5e76ea1242a2939b71e
(cherry picked from commit 13acdfba3727728451640c77fa40538ca615949d)

subject: Replace six.iteritems() with .items()
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-06 14:09:16.000000000', 'files': ['fuelclient/cli/actions/plugins.py', 'fuelclient/objects/openstack_config.py', 'fuelclient/v1/base_v1.py', 'fuelclient/v1/plugins.py', 'fuelclient/v1/deployment_history.py', 'fuelclient/tests/utils/fake_plugin.py'], 'message': 'Replace six.iteritems() with .items()

1.As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using
six.iteritems to achieve iterators. We can
use dict.items instead, as it will return
iterators in PY3 as well. And dict.items/keys
will more readable. 2.In py2, the performance
about list should be negligible, see the link [2].
[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: Icd8635f99bb76b38668c631be74fdeb70e59e440
'}]
commit_message:
Replace six.iteritems() with .items()

1.As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using
six.iteritems to achieve iterators. We can
use dict.items instead, as it will return
iterators in PY3 as well. And dict.items/keys
will more readable. 2.In py2, the performance
about list should be negligible, see the link [2].
[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: Icd8635f99bb76b38668c631be74fdeb70e59e440
