revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-06-08 07:25:46.000000000', 'files': ['setup.cfg'], 'message': 'Remove support for py34.

The gating on python 3.4 is restricted to <= Mitaka. This is due to
the change from Ubuntu Trusty to Xenial, where only python3.5 is
available. There is no need to continue to keep these settings.

Change-Id: Iab562c5bea2abbb84d34e9f4d1cfcc7b64b845aa
'}]
commit_message:
Remove support for py34.

The gating on python 3.4 is restricted to <= Mitaka. This is due to
the change from Ubuntu Trusty to Xenial, where only python3.5 is
available. There is no need to continue to keep these settings.

Change-Id: Iab562c5bea2abbb84d34e9f4d1cfcc7b64b845aa

commit_message:
Retire repository

Fuel (from openstack namespace) and fuel-ccp (in x namespace)
repositories are unused and ready to retire.

This change removes all content from the repository and adds the usual
README file to point out that the repository is retired following the
process from
https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/drivers.html#retiring-a-project

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-December/011647.html

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/699362
Change-Id: I1cdc15fbd41ebea088c76729abf6b120165b9ed1

commit_message:
Retire fuel and fuel-ccp repositories (step 2)

Retire fuel from openstack namespace and fuel-ccp from x namespace,
these repositories are dead.
This includes the tuning-box repo, it's part of fuel.

Announcement:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-December/011647.html

Also remove fuel-specs from specs index page.

This is step 2 in
https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/drivers.html#retiring-a-project

subject: reviewers: make --project and --stable mutually exclusive
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-11-04 16:16:55.000000000', 'files': ['reviewstats/cmd/reviewers.py'], 'message': "reviewers: make --project and --stable mutually exclusive

When using the reviewers command to get stats on stable branch
reviews, I always think I can specify --stable and --project nova
to get nova stable reviews, but that's not how the command
works and the --project option is ignored resulting in a report
which I don't expect, i.e. there are non-nova reviewers in the
report.

This makes --project and --stable mutually exclusive to avoid that
confusion.

Change-Id: Ie9938f5e68f27b9a5a58635be2185365f041136f
"}]
commit_message:
reviewers: make --project and --stable mutually exclusive

When using the reviewers command to get stats on stable branch
reviews, I always think I can specify --stable and --project nova
to get nova stable reviews, but that's not how the command
works and the --project option is ignored resulting in a report
which I don't expect, i.e. there are non-nova reviewers in the
report.

This makes --project and --stable mutually exclusive to avoid that
confusion.

Change-Id: Ie9938f5e68f27b9a5a58635be2185365f041136f

to use argparse instead.

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-12-17 19:19:37.000000000', 'files': ['docker/monasca/monasca-grafana/Dockerfile.j2'], 'message': 'Fix monasca-grafana being unbuildable due to old npm

Affected builds on Ubuntu which had:
npm 3.5.2
while the latest was:
npm 6.13.4
And CentOS had:
npm 5.6.0

This patch runs npm update via npm.
Pinned to 6.x.

Additionally, this moves npm packages prefix (root) to
/usr/local to avoid conflicts with native packages.

Change-Id: Ibaacc1cc478b2b2f8196a5da4eea3570d7d310ff
Closes-bug: #1856699
(cherry picked from commit 308e85aa413da84ed107b27fa09a3f0e0a64392f)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix monasca-grafana being unbuildable due to old npm

Affected builds on Ubuntu which had:
npm 3.5.2
while the latest was:
npm 6.13.4
And CentOS had:
npm 5.6.0

This patch runs npm update via npm.
Pinned to 6.x.

Additionally, this moves npm packages prefix (root) to
/usr/local to avoid conflicts with native packages.

Change-Id: Ibaacc1cc478b2b2f8196a5da4eea3570d7d310ff
Closes-bug: #1856699
(cherry picked from commit 308e85aa413da84ed107b27fa09a3f0e0a64392f)

commit_message:
Tune down multinode concurrency

Reduce the multinode concurrency and number
of VMs so we don't run Rackspace VMs out of
disk space.

This is an issue that was reported by the
infra team.

[0]: http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-ironic/%23openstack-ironic.2019-12-16.log.html#t2019-12-16T17:38:15

Change-Id: I867bac9e247605e561cc7ee4522f70ce6de368d4

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 2472, 'name': 'Doug Hellmann', 'email': 'dhellmann@redhat.com', 'username': 'doug-hellmann'}, {'_account_id': 6476, 'name': 'Thomas Goirand', 'email': 'thomas@goirand.fr', 'username': 'thomas-goirand'}, {'_account_id': 6928, 'name': 'Ben Nemec', 'email': 'openstack@nemebean.com', 'username': 'bnemec'}, {'_account_id': 9796, 'name': 'ChangBo Guo', 'email': 'glongwave@gmail.com', 'username': 'gcb'}, {'_account_id': 15334, 'name': 'Stephen Finucane', 'display_name': 'stephenfin', 'email': 'stephenfin@redhat.com', 'username': 'sfinucan'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 26297, 'name': 'pippo', 'email': '1211099771@qq.com', 'username': 'huang.zhiping'}, {'_account_id': 28522, 'name': 'Hervé Beraud', 'email': 'herveberaud.pro@gmail.com', 'username': 'hberaud'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2019-12-18 14:45:42.000000000', 'files': ['tools/oslo_debug_helper', 'tools/oslo_run_cross_tests'], 'message': 'Invoke correct python version in shell scripts

The oslotest shell scripts were using /usr/bin/python by default, and did
take into account the $PYTHON variable, so one could choose to use
Python 3 instead of Python 2.

This patch looks if a $PYTHON variable exists. If not, then it sets it
to "python" by default, otherwise, it uses whatever exists, so it is now
possible to do PYTHON=python3 oslo_debug_helper for starting tests.

Change-Id: I6df0ac0d84fd964251a1af9e27dadb954a2ad691
'}]
commit_message:
Invoke correct python version in shell scripts

The oslotest shell scripts were using /usr/bin/python by default, and did
take into account the $PYTHON variable, so one could choose to use
Python 3 instead of Python 2.

This patch looks if a $PYTHON variable exists. If not, then it sets it
to "python" by default, otherwise, it uses whatever exists, so it is now
possible to do PYTHON=python3 oslo_debug_helper for starting tests.

Change-Id: I6df0ac0d84fd964251a1af9e27dadb954a2ad691

commit_message:
Remove the neutron-grenade job definition

All the user of neutron-grenade from Ussuri gate
onwards has been switched to grenade-py3 job (except
neutron which is running neutron-grenade-multinode).

We can remove the job definition also now and all
stable gate using this job will find the job definition
from neutron stable branches.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/694234/
Change-Id: I631f0bfbe7e4ee2df89e2eca2060331796e7a0b2

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-12-16 22:17:22.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/tests/unit/drivers/modules/test_agent_base_vendor.py', 'ironic/tests/unit/api/controllers/v1/test_ramdisk.py', 'ironic/conductor/manager.py', 'ironic/tests/unit/conductor/test_utils.py', 'ironic/tests/unit/conductor/test_manager.py', 'ironic/api/controllers/v1/ramdisk.py', 'ironic/conductor/utils.py', 'releasenotes/notes/prevent-callback-url-from-being-updated-41d50b20fb236e82.yaml'], 'message': 'Block ability update callback_url

A malicious user with:

* API access normally reserved for the provisioning,
  cleaning, rescue networks.
* Insight about a node, such as a MAC address, or baremetal node
  UUID.
* Insight into the state of the node, such as the access provided
  to Compute API users, or other Bare Metal API users.

Can submit an erroneous ``heartbeat`` to the ironic-api endpoint
with a ``callback_url`` that is not of the actual intended agent.
This can potentially cause a rescue, cleaning, or deployment
operation to be derailed, or at worst commands to be sent to
to an endpoint the malicious user controls.

Story: 2006773
Task: 37295
Change-Id: I1a5e3c2b34d45c06fb74e82d0f30735ce9041914
(cherry picked from commit 931c12598296dad676b2d64b66fef6e95ad3939b)
'}]
commit_message:
Block ability update callback_url

A malicious user with:

* API access normally reserved for the provisioning,
  cleaning, rescue networks.
* Insight about a node, such as a MAC address, or baremetal node
  UUID.
* Insight into the state of the node, such as the access provided
  to Compute API users, or other Bare Metal API users.

Can submit an erroneous ``heartbeat`` to the ironic-api endpoint
with a ``callback_url`` that is not of the actual intended agent.
This can potentially cause a rescue, cleaning, or deployment
operation to be derailed, or at worst commands to be sent to
to an endpoint the malicious user controls.

Story: 2006773
Task: 37295
Change-Id: I1a5e3c2b34d45c06fb74e82d0f30735ce9041914
(cherry picked from commit 931c12598296dad676b2d64b66fef6e95ad3939b)

commit_message:
pbr show-next-version command

Allow to display the next release version, as
calculated using sem-ver footers in commit messages.

Also available:
    python setup.py show_release_version

Change-Id: I4ba355225c7f22f1923acb7fd844deb61a1720ea
sem-ver: feature
Signed-off-by: Gaetan Semet <gaetan@xeberon.net>

Update sphinx networkx requirements to match g-r

commit_message:
Don't run bandit during the pep8 tox run

There is already a tox section for bandit which can be executed via
"tox -ebandit". The command in the pep8 section is just a
duplication.

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-12-17 19:19:53.000000000', 'files': ['docker/monasca/monasca-grafana/Dockerfile.j2'], 'message': 'Fix monasca-grafana being unbuildable due to old npm

Affected builds on Ubuntu which had:
npm 3.5.2
while the latest was:
npm 6.13.4
And CentOS had:
npm 5.6.0

This patch runs npm update via npm.
Pinned to 6.x.

Additionally, this moves npm packages prefix (root) to

Change-Id: Ibaacc1cc478b2b2f8196a5da4eea3570d7d310ff

(cherry picked from commit 308e85aa413da84ed107b27fa09a3f0e0a64392f)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix monasca-grafana being unbuildable due to old npm

Affected builds on Ubuntu which had:
npm 3.5.2
while the latest was:
npm 6.13.4
And CentOS had:
npm 5.6.0

This patch runs npm update via npm.
Pinned to 6.x.

Additionally, this moves npm packages prefix (root) to
/usr/local to avoid conflicts with native packages.

Change-Id: Ibaacc1cc478b2b2f8196a5da4eea3570d7d310ff
Closes-bug: #1856699
(cherry picked from commit 308e85aa413da84ed107b27fa09a3f0e0a64392f)

commit_message:
Add missing PIP requirements PyMySQL and SQLAlchemy

SQLAlchemy and PyMySQL are missing in requirements.txt/lower-constraints.txt
when osprofiler is isolated from other OpenStack components for instance
installed in Python virtual or in separated container.

Change-Id: I6a8e31177e5adf0a54c2a3ed0b0de18ad0f2ded9
Closes-Bug: #1826646

commit_message:
WIP: Add in-memory key_manager.

The VanillaKeyManager is a in-memory key_manager for development
and testing purposes only. It eliminates the requirement of an
external party such as OpenStack Barbican or HashiCorp Vault
in order to test the KeyManager API.

Change-Id: Ie296b1b195b142ebf9870b1e1ae6a3efc107a8e4
Signed-off-by: Moisés Guimarães de Medeiros <moguimar@redhat.com>

commit_message:
cmd: 'pbr boostrap' create setup.[cfg,py] automatically

PBR-adicted developpers could install pbr user-wide with:

  pip install --user pbr

From then, one would be able to create a setup.py and
setup.cfg with:

  pbr bootstrap

sem-ver: feature

Change-Id: I0a3ff3ad0220a10ac507c8f555651e4fee114c8c
Signed-off-by: Gaetan Semet <gaetan@xeberon.net>

commit_message:
WIP: mock: Fixes missing _autospec key issue

This issue can be encountered when mock.patch is used with
additional kwargs. mock.configure_mock is called before its
_autospec is set.

Change-Id: I388b942b0eb99673adeb5a9073ac2e8f7eb0588f

subject: WIP: mock: Makes _AutospecMagicMock a subclass of _AutospecMock
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-08-27 14:24:18.000000000', 'files': ['oslotest/mock_fixture.py', 'oslotest/tests/unit/test_mock_fixture.py'], 'message': 'WIP: mock: Makes _AutospecMagicMock a subclass of _AutospecMock

In the mock module, MagicMock is a subclass of Mock, and the autospec
classes should reflect that.

This is needed for a few tests which checks if an object is an instance
of mock.Mock (_AutospecMock if the mock fixture is used), which would
fail if it is a mock.MagicMock instead (_AutospecMagicMock).

Change-Id: I20f4fb465a81ab64c5b26434ba1a3fa63bfd97d8
'}]
commit_message:
WIP: mock: Makes _AutospecMagicMock a subclass of _AutospecMock

In the mock module, MagicMock is a subclass of Mock, and the autospec
classes should reflect that.

This is needed for a few tests which checks if an object is an instance
of mock.Mock (_AutospecMock if the mock fixture is used), which would
fail if it is a mock.MagicMock instead (_AutospecMagicMock).

Change-Id: I20f4fb465a81ab64c5b26434ba1a3fa63bfd97d8

subject: Calculate timestamps within DB
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-08-16 08:05:31.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_db/sqlalchemy/models.py'], 'message': 'Calculate timestamps within DB

Calculating the timestamp in the clients can lead to problems
because network latency is variable, clients experience slightly
different clock drift.

The SQLAlchemy allows us to do this by passing func.now() which
tells the DB to calculate the timestamp itself.

So, in order to make the updated_at and created_at more accurate,
we should calculate the timestamp in db.

Closes-bug: #1787345

Change-Id: I848035e8e8fe53698cafe1571889d74ec65b64f1
'}]
commit_message:
Calculate timestamps within DB

Calculating the timestamp in the clients can lead to problems
because network latency is variable, clients experience slightly
different clock drift.

The SQLAlchemy allows us to do this by passing func.now() which
tells the DB to calculate the timestamp itself.

So, in order to make the updated_at and created_at more accurate,
we should calculate the timestamp in db.

Closes-bug: #1787345

Change-Id: I848035e8e8fe53698cafe1571889d74ec65b64f1

subject: Add last finished strategy + fast forward
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2018-02-21 13:47:25.000000000', 'files': ['futurist/periodics.py'], 'message': "Add last finished strategy + fast forward

The existing 'aligned_last_finished' was potentially
over-running earlier by aligning
to the nearest time even if the difference between the
last finish time and the next time was less than
the expected spacing. In order to fix this when this
situation happens we need to shift forward to the
next multiple and use that instead.

So this adds a new strategy that does just that.

Change-Id: Idc065484fe58a2ac419a83fc73228d9305ef15f7
"}]
commit_message:
Add last finished strategy + fast forward

The existing 'aligned_last_finished' was potentially
over-running earlier by aligning
to the nearest time even if the difference between the
last finish time and the next time was less than
the expected spacing. In order to fix this when this
situation happens we need to shift forward to the
next multiple and use that instead.

So this adds a new strategy that does just that.

Change-Id: Idc065484fe58a2ac419a83fc73228d9305ef15f7

Use spice_agent_enabled key from cloud-compute relation

spice_agent_enabled is provided by nova-cloud-controller to inform
nova-compute the value that needs to be set in the configuration option
[spice].agent_enabled

subject: Minimal changes to maintain CI with Neutron master

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-12-17 14:40:56.000000000', 'files': ['networking_calico/tests/py3_test_dhcp_agent.py', 'networking_calico/tests/py3_test_subnet_watcher.py', 'setup.cfg', 'tox.ini'], 'message': "Minimal changes to maintain CI with Neutron master

- Hide (by renaming) test files that import Neutron code that now
requires Python 3.  We cannot run those test files anymore, until
we (a) figure out how to run them with an older Neutron version,
or (b) fix the networking-calico as a whole to run under Python 3.

- Remove declarations that we support Python 3, as this is actually
not the case.

- Also remove pypy tox environment, as I don't believe we've ever had

Change-Id: Ib9c5dec59eb5bffad5ce5d9d13be07e513048871
"}]
commit_message:
Minimal changes to maintain CI with Neutron master

- Hide (by renaming) test files that import Neutron code that now
requires Python 3.  We cannot run those test files anymore, until
we (a) figure out how to run them with an older Neutron version,
or (b) fix the networking-calico as a whole to run under Python 3.

- Remove declarations that we support Python 3, as this is actually
not the case.

- Also remove pypy tox environment, as I don't believe we've ever had
any value from it, and other networking-* projects don't have it.

Change-Id: Ib9c5dec59eb5bffad5ce5d9d13be07e513048871

commit_message:
Ceph plugin updates for Luminous

Since the Luminous release of Ceph, the plugin no longer exports metrics
such as object storage daemon stats, placement groups and pool stats.
Check for the installed version of the Ceph command and parse results
according to version.

Include test data for Jewel and Luminous Ceph clusters.

Story: 2005032
Task: 29515

Change-Id: I0aef0db25f49545c715b07880edd57135e3beafe
Co-Authored-By: Bharat Kunwar <bharat@stackhpc.com>
Co-Authored-By: Doug Szumski <doug@stackhpc.com>

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 4690, 'name': 'melanie witt', 'display_name': 'melwitt', 'email': 'melwittt@gmail.com', 'username': 'melwitt'}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 14595, 'name': 'z Systems KVM', 'email': 'zkvm-ci@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'ibm-zkvm-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 16128, 'name': 'IBM PowerVM CI', 'email': 'powervmci@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powervmci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 17685, 'name': 'Elod Illes', 'email': 'elod.illes@est.tech', 'username': 'elod.illes'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 26515, 'name': 'Cloudbase Nova Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'nova_hyperv_ci@cloudbasesolutions.com', 'username': 'nova_hyperv_ci'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-06-21 15:27:11.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/api/openstack/compute/test_services.py', 'releasenotes/notes/bug-1811726-multi-node-delete-2ba17f02c6171fbb.yaml', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/services.py'], 'message': "Delete resource providers for all nodes when deleting compute service

Change I7b8622b178d5043ed1556d7bdceaf60f47e5ac80 started deleting the
compute node resource provider associated with a compute node when
deleting a nova-compute service. However, it would only delete the
first compute node associated with the service which means for an
ironic compute service that is managing multiple nodes, the resource
providers were not cleaned up in placement. This fixes the issue by
iterating all the compute nodes and cleaning up their providers.
Note this could be potentially a lot of nodes, but we don't really
have many good options here but to iterate them and clean them up
one at a time.

Note that this is best-effort but because of how the
SchedulerReportClient.delete_resource_provider method ignores
ResourceProviderInUse errors, and we could have stale allocations
on the host for which delete_resource_provider is not accounting,
namely allocations from evacuated instances (or incomplete migrations
though you can't migrate baremetal instances today), we could still
delete the compute service and orphan those in-use providers. That,
however, is no worse than before this change where we did not try
to cleanup all providers. The issue described above is being tracked
with bug 1829479 and will be dealt with separately.

Change-Id: I9e852e25ea89f32bf19cdaeb1f5dac8f749f5dbc
Closes-Bug: #1811726
(cherry picked from commit 650fe118d128f09f78552b82abc114bb4b84930e)
(cherry picked from commit e9889be94ee58a6da78ef96d09d8f5282b86f648)
(cherry picked from commit 64d52788831f0e676f0b9bf9780eeadb38232def)
(cherry picked from commit b2f438bab4a0fdaa37b1a57cff0b27fb2a3f3437)
"}]
commit_message:
Delete resource providers for all nodes when deleting compute service

Change I7b8622b178d5043ed1556d7bdceaf60f47e5ac80 started deleting the
compute node resource provider associated with a compute node when
deleting a nova-compute service. However, it would only delete the
first compute node associated with the service which means for an
ironic compute service that is managing multiple nodes, the resource
providers were not cleaned up in placement. This fixes the issue by
iterating all the compute nodes and cleaning up their providers.
Note this could be potentially a lot of nodes, but we don't really
have many good options here but to iterate them and clean them up
one at a time.

Note that this is best-effort but because of how the
SchedulerReportClient.delete_resource_provider method ignores
ResourceProviderInUse errors, and we could have stale allocations
on the host for which delete_resource_provider is not accounting,
namely allocations from evacuated instances (or incomplete migrations
though you can't migrate baremetal instances today), we could still
delete the compute service and orphan those in-use providers. That,
however, is no worse than before this change where we did not try
to cleanup all providers. The issue described above is being tracked
with bug 1829479 and will be dealt with separately.

Change-Id: I9e852e25ea89f32bf19cdaeb1f5dac8f749f5dbc
Closes-Bug: #1811726
(cherry picked from commit 650fe118d128f09f78552b82abc114bb4b84930e)
(cherry picked from commit e9889be94ee58a6da78ef96d09d8f5282b86f648)
(cherry picked from commit 64d52788831f0e676f0b9bf9780eeadb38232def)
(cherry picked from commit b2f438bab4a0fdaa37b1a57cff0b27fb2a3f3437)

commit_message:
Remove py2 testing, jobs

Change tox.ini so that all jobs are python3, and add explicit
unit/functional testenvs for the two ussuri python runtimes
(3.6 and 3.7).

Remove py2 jobs from .zuul.yaml and redefine the periodic "tips"
jobs so that they are testing with the ussuri python runtimes.
Added nodeset: ubuntu-bionic to the abstract base jobs so that
py3.7 is available.

Co-authored-by: Ghanshyam Mann <gmann@ghanshyammann.com>
Co-authored-by: Brian Rosmaita <rosmaita.fossdev@gmail.com>

Closes-bug: #1853693
Change-Id: I15467c34fc8466fa1724c5401dc879ae77c1922d

commit_message:
Exclude build request marker from server listing

When listing "real" (already in cell) instances e.g. from
nova_cell1.instances table, a marker option means "start after the
instance with marker".

For VMs:

| uuid | name |
| 1    | vm1  |
| 2    | vm2  |

"openstack server list --marker 1" returns vm2 only.

But for VMs from nova_api.build_requests table it's different.

For VMs:

| uuid | name |
| 1    | vm1  |
| 2    | vm2  |

"openstack server list --marker 1" returns both vm1 and vm2.

This patch excludes instance with marker from listing for
instances from build_requests table.

Closes-Bug: #1808286
Change-Id: I5165b69f956fbf1904112a742698b2739f747e72
(cherry picked from commit 2ef704cba619a149336692311c2614742aa32909)
(cherry picked from commit 3eb0ba988f4cfca4399c92cd6bb7b4ae8665720c)
(cherry picked from commit 8aadd4ebdfea3f1b46b2e2e62b355e8b40b6261b)
(cherry picked from commit 3d3a263789c5cc49899d63d18f9233c981f5b894)

commit_message:
Fix pep8 errors found by hacking 2.0.0

Fix the following issues that are now exposed by hacking version 2.0.0

./networking_ovn/tests/unit/common/test_hash_ring_manager.py:92:38:
F602 dictionary key variable another_host_node repeated with different
values

Also fixing

./networking_ovn/ovsdb/ovsdb_monitor.py:359:13: F841 local variable

But that is already fixed in the neutron repo, so this is only an
issue in networking-ovn repo.

commit_message:
Add traps for py3 and fix remote src

This change adds traps for the FileNotFound exception which is used instead
of OSError when a file is not found. This will ensure that that fall back
exception handeling works properly in py2 and py3.

The remote_src flag was not being respected with the new fallback options,
this change adds a check for remote_src so it works in normal and fallback
mode.

Change-Id: I136dd1f3220d3b004d5275a9fa15edea53d58f6b
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Properly set loopback_users via rabbitmq::loopback_users

Sorta resurrecting https://review.opendev.org/#/c/324016/ now that
https://github.com/voxpupuli/puppet-rabbitmq/pull/699 merged.

This commit prevents a duplicate entry for loopback_users in the
rabbitmq.config file:

{loopback_users, [<<"guest">>]},
{loopback_users, []},

keeping only the expected empty array.

Note: not a 100% clean cherry pick due to tht path changes.

(cherry picked from commit 04a5937e1f1482dd3115ddc809c555abea87e69d)

Change-Id: I0c291bf5611f02983c430179206556bae3b38736

commit_message:
Ignore devices with OSError

This bug handles OSError when trying to read from CDrom devices with no
disc in the is_pristine_disk function which makes the run-action
list-disks to fail.

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 14826, 'name': 'Mark Goddard', 'email': 'markgoddard86@gmail.com', 'username': 'mgoddard'}, {'_account_id': 17669, 'name': 'Doug Szumski', 'email': 'doug@stackhpc.com', 'username': 'DougSzumski'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 24072, 'name': 'Marcin Juszkiewicz', 'email': 'mjuszkiewicz@redhat.com', 'username': 'hrw'}, {'_account_id': 30491, 'name': 'Radosław Piliszek', 'display_name': 'Radek', 'email': 'radek@piliszek.it', 'username': 'yoctozepto', 'status': 'self-employed techologist, collaborating mostly with 7bulls.com'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-12-09 14:12:58.000000000', 'files': ['ansible/roles/common/templates/conf/input/04-openstack-wsgi.conf.j2', 'ansible/roles/common/templates/conf/input/00-global.conf.j2', 'releasenotes/notes/fix-wsgi-log-collection-c9f347096394df5c.yaml'], 'message': 'Fix fluentd parsing of WSGI logs

WSGI log files use a different input configuration than OpenStack log
files. Currently this depends on log files matching either *-access.log
or *-error.log. Some services use *_access.log or *_error.log, so are
not parsed correctly.

This change modifies the fluentd configuration to accept an underscore
or hyphen for WSGI log file names.

Change-Id: I566d6cac0b6749054fd5422ec8f36f99dacb1db7
Closes-Bug: #1720371
'}]
commit_message:
Fix fluentd parsing of WSGI logs

WSGI log files use a different input configuration than OpenStack log
files. Currently this depends on log files matching either *-access.log
or *-error.log. Some services use *_access.log or *_error.log, so are
not parsed correctly.

This change modifies the fluentd configuration to accept an underscore
or hyphen for WSGI log file names.

Change-Id: I566d6cac0b6749054fd5422ec8f36f99dacb1db7
Closes-Bug: #1720371

commit_message:
Fix monasca-grafana being unbuildable due to old npm

Affected builds on Ubuntu which had:
npm 3.5.2
while the latest was:
npm 6.13.4
And CentOS had:
npm 5.6.0

This patch runs npm update via npm.
Pinned to 6.x.

Additionally, this moves npm packages prefix (root) to
/usr/local to avoid conflicts with native packages.

Change-Id: Ibaacc1cc478b2b2f8196a5da4eea3570d7d310ff
Closes-bug: #1856699
(cherry picked from commit 308e85aa413da84ed107b27fa09a3f0e0a64392f)

subject: Return version from egg-info and dist-info directly
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2017-06-03 15:10:36.000000000', 'files': ['pbr/version.py'], 'message': "Return version from egg-info and dist-info directly

Rather than using pkg-resources to read the version for a package, which
does a scan of all of the dirs on sys.path and then reading all of the
files in each of the egg-info and dist-info directories found, calculate
the directory from the module import and load the file.

This still will require a scan of the directory the module is in, which
is unavoidable because it's not possible to know the directory of the
metadata without knowing the version, but it should at least cut down
the number of directories scanned and the number of files read that
don't need to be read.

Change-Id: I46e65a1d4bd5cd8cd0b8efd118d13cab7c6e1925
"}]
commit_message:
Return version from egg-info and dist-info directly

Rather than using pkg-resources to read the version for a package, which
does a scan of all of the dirs on sys.path and then reading all of the
files in each of the egg-info and dist-info directories found, calculate
the directory from the module import and load the file.

This still will require a scan of the directory the module is in, which
is unavoidable because it's not possible to know the directory of the
metadata without knowing the version, but it should at least cut down
the number of directories scanned and the number of files read that
don't need to be read.

Change-Id: I46e65a1d4bd5cd8cd0b8efd118d13cab7c6e1925

subject: Ensure option groups don't change during logging
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-12-18 00:54:29.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_config/cfg.py'], 'message': "Ensure option groups don't change during logging

oslo.config allows us to configure groups and options dynamically. This
can cause a race with our logging as we attempt to iterate through
option groups that are changing under our feet. This wouldn't be a huge
issue, since these are just logs are we can always log again, if needed,
but we store groups in a dictionary and Python doesn't like us changing
the size of a dict it's iterating through:

  RuntimeError: dictionary changed size during iteration

Given that we're only reading through this option group and don't need
to worry about a group _disappearing_, the solution is pretty simple:
create a copy of our option group names ahead of time so we don't need
to worry about new ones coming and messing things up.

No tests are included since this is a race and the only way I see to
reproduce this would involve lots of ugly threading.

Change-Id: Id3b28465d645a24f0fcebff2dd68a9bd30e21594
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1856312
(cherry picked from commit e3e2ba55eeeb86a9bc0624bb2592e46583e839e7)
"}]
commit_message:
Ensure option groups don't change during logging

oslo.config allows us to configure groups and options dynamically. This
can cause a race with our logging as we attempt to iterate through
option groups that are changing under our feet. This wouldn't be a huge
issue, since these are just logs are we can always log again, if needed,
but we store groups in a dictionary and Python doesn't like us changing
the size of a dict it's iterating through:

  RuntimeError: dictionary changed size during iteration

Given that we're only reading through this option group and don't need
to worry about a group _disappearing_, the solution is pretty simple:
create a copy of our option group names ahead of time so we don't need
to worry about new ones coming and messing things up.

No tests are included since this is a race and the only way I see to
reproduce this would involve lots of ugly threading.

Change-Id: Id3b28465d645a24f0fcebff2dd68a9bd30e21594
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1856312
(cherry picked from commit e3e2ba55eeeb86a9bc0624bb2592e46583e839e7)

but we store groups in a dictionary and Python doesn't like us changing
the size of a dict it's iterating through:

  RuntimeError: dictionary changed size during iteration

Given that we're only reading through this option group and don't need
to worry about a group _disappearing_, the solution is pretty simple:

commit_message:
Use topo ordering to correctly sort changelog entries

Call git log with --topo-order so that old changes merged in after a
tagged release do not appear in the changelog entries for that release.

Change-Id: I9ea5ef4d1d7c3ec4d57d17a40c67971c30ec6105

revisions:

readthedocs.org looks for docs/requirements.txt and if found will
install those files before building docs. We currently lump all of our
doc requirements in with test requirements in OpenStack, which makes it
harder to keep clear why a particular requirement is desired.

Similar to parsing and adding test-requirements.txt to the test extra,
add an extra called 'docs' and put the contents of doc/requirements.txt
in it. This should allow us to have repos that are more generally
compatible with the wider ecosystem, and to stop installing

Change-Id: Ibc46e0132c233b6f7f2e9dfc6a6f8e2e2ed4643c

commit_message:
Add support for a docs extra aligned with RTD locations

readthedocs.org looks for docs/requirements.txt and if found will
install those files before building docs. We currently lump all of our
doc requirements in with test requirements in OpenStack, which makes it
harder to keep clear why a particular requirement is desired.

Similar to parsing and adding test-requirements.txt to the test extra,
add an extra called 'docs' and put the contents of doc/requirements.txt
in it. This should allow us to have repos that are more generally
compatible with the wider ecosystem, and to stop installing
documentation generation packages for unittests if we don't otherwise
need to.

Change-Id: Ibc46e0132c233b6f7f2e9dfc6a6f8e2e2ed4643c

commit_message:
Fix failure of updating old version object

Update of old version object fails when
object doesn't have a attribute which
has been added newly in latest version.

We should consider this case by
accepting a NotImplementedError.

Closes-Bug: #1615922
Change-Id: I2c9773ba06aa5d7af0c4c74e3090e219843ed3e1

commit_message:
Change python3.5 job to python3.7 job on Stein+

python3.5 was the only supported python3 version on Xenial, now that we have
Bionic Beaver nodes that support python3.7, lets switch to testing with
python3.7 in addition with python3.6 in Stein and beyond.
See ML discussion here [1] for context.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-October/135632.html

Change-Id: If13bc1027ab9688815ed011380e61ef0f5c3c3a7
Signed-off-by: Charles Short <chucks@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add eventlet-aware Timer object to eventletutils

This Timer object is a copy of the threading.Timer implementation,
except it uses the eventlet-aware Event implementation from
eventletutils.  This avoids busy-waiting on Events that occurs when
using the threading implementation with eventlet.

Change-Id: Ib727fb3fd67864a7334097e5bfeed694b39248ce

subject: Check for valid uuid length
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-09-04 12:23:39.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_utils/tests/test_uuidutils.py', 'oslo_utils/uuidutils.py'], 'message': 'Check for valid uuid length

A valid uuid consists of 32 characters and 4 -(hyphens).
As per current behavior if user passes more -(hyphens)
in uuid (for example, aaaa---aaaa-aaaa----aaaa-aaaa---aaaa-aaaa-aaaa)
then is_uuit_like function treats it as valid uuid and returns True
because while checking it is replacing all - with empty string and
checking for 32 characters only. This is causing db error where in
database table uuid value is set to 36 but actual value of uuid is
greater than that.

To resolve this issue I have added a new method name as
"format_canonical_uuid" in the uuidutils module which will verify
the fixed number of hyphens in the uuid and convert it in a valid
format and returns otherwise treat it as invalid uuid and raise
ValueError with appropriate error message.

Related-Bug: #1680130
Change-Id: Ic2e9aabc644ef386813a03f1d7d570e86f8705af
'}]
commit_message:
Check for valid uuid length

A valid uuid consists of 32 characters and 4 -(hyphens).
As per current behavior if user passes more -(hyphens)
in uuid (for example, aaaa---aaaa-aaaa----aaaa-aaaa---aaaa-aaaa-aaaa)
then is_uuit_like function treats it as valid uuid and returns True
because while checking it is replacing all - with empty string and
checking for 32 characters only. This is causing db error where in
database table uuid value is set to 36 but actual value of uuid is
greater than that.

To resolve this issue I have added a new method name as
"format_canonical_uuid" in the uuidutils module which will verify
the fixed number of hyphens in the uuid and convert it in a valid
format and returns otherwise treat it as invalid uuid and raise
ValueError with appropriate error message.

Related-Bug: #1680130
Change-Id: Ic2e9aabc644ef386813a03f1d7d570e86f8705af

Sometimes it is more appropriate to use a projects own logger
instead of the default root logger, so make such a thing possible
to do.

This also removes the usage of mox from the retry exception
testing and replaces it with mock instead (because the tests

Change-Id: Ia0f4adbc5f62be0a6a35a4c698b2779581171ca7

commit_message:
Allow 'forever_retry_uncaught_exceptions' to take a custom logger

Sometimes it is more appropriate to use a projects own logger
instead of the default root logger, so make such a thing possible
to do.

This also removes the usage of mox from the retry exception
testing and replaces it with mock instead (because the tests
were affected and just removing old & busted mox is easier at
this point).

Change-Id: Ia0f4adbc5f62be0a6a35a4c698b2779581171ca7

commit_message:
Add a safe_format to strutils

Formatting strings has the potential to be unsafe because it
allows access to builtins such as __class__, __init__, as indicated
in [1].

It's more dangerous when the format is used with a parameter that
is a Python object.

[1]: http://lucumr.pocoo.org/2016/12/29/careful-with-str-format/

Change-Id: I1300bac4276facf2fe16af1b7028f56bdc9b482f

in 2018 when the range is very large. With a soft limit of 1048576,
benchmark.py reports an overhead of ~ 400ms without this patch and 2ms

commit_message:
Run rootwrap with lower fd ulimit by default

On Python 2.x, a subprocess.Popen() with close_fds=True will
fork and then close filedescriptors range(3..os.sysconf("SC_OPEN_MAX")),
which thanks to Kernel PTI (Kaiser patches) is significantly slower
in 2018 when the range is very large. With a soft limit of 1048576,
benchmark.py reports an overhead of ~ 400ms without this patch and 2ms
with the patch applied. This patch adds a configuration option and
leaves it disabled for the stable/* backports to not change default
behavior.

Also includes Ben Nemec's release note entry, adjusted for the stable
backport. This is Ib29e96307caa39c21936f216d9aed7907e7a7331 for master.

Also includes I2391315f77718a3c9eb9fc8c03a6882237f33548 from master.

Also includes I3b481ddd14ae2b948270d715aad157cf3996def7 from master.

(cherry picked from commit c0a86998203315858721a7b2c8ab75fbf5cd51d9)
(cherry picked from commit 8f148f5e9e786d8a3922b0d5ae29bc54b8e8e1e9)
(cherry picked from commit 5259c08c09eb3aeab64af928cddf84bc213594d3)

Closes-Bug: 1796267
Closes-Bug: #1804639
Change-Id: Idd98c183eca3e2df8648fc0f37d27fe9cc6d0563
(cherry picked from commit c338f2c5c79abd44be5da495ae980fe7aefe194d)

subject: Avoid importing eventlet.patcher from cmd.py
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2019-03-26 08:32:02.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_rootwrap/daemon.py', 'oslo_rootwrap/tests/test_rootwrap.py', 'test-requirements.txt', 'oslo_rootwrap/client.py', 'oslo_rootwrap/tests/test_functional.py', 'oslo_rootwrap/wrapper.py', 'oslo_rootwrap/cmd.py', 'lower-constraints.txt', 'oslo_rootwrap/tests/run_daemon.py', 'tox.ini', 'oslo_rootwrap/__init__.py'], 'message': "Avoid importing eventlet.patcher from cmd.py

By importing eventlet.patcher from the main module initialisation,
we're importing a large part of code unnecessarily for the short-lived
rootwrap client case. With the existing code this is:

  $ time sudo /usr/bin/cinder-rootwrap /etc/cinder/rootwrap.conf id
  uid=0(root) gid=0(root) groups=0(root)

  real    0m4,067s
  user    0m0,821s
  sys     0m0,185s

This is because it imports various DNS and crypto libraries (which
in return do setup a lot of things like gather entropy and the like).
With this patch this reduces to:

  $ time sudo /usr/bin/cinder-rootwrap /etc/cinder/rootwrap.conf id
  uid=0(root) gid=0(root) groups=0(root)

  real    0m1,279s
  user    0m0,192s
  sys     0m0,060s

which is, depending on which metrics you're looking at, up to 4 times
faster.

Change-Id: If098738924e78e76d1c19a329dd8db509022c922
"}]
commit_message:
Avoid importing eventlet.patcher from cmd.py

By importing eventlet.patcher from the main module initialisation,
we're importing a large part of code unnecessarily for the short-lived
rootwrap client case. With the existing code this is:

  $ time sudo /usr/bin/cinder-rootwrap /etc/cinder/rootwrap.conf id
  uid=0(root) gid=0(root) groups=0(root)

  real    0m4,067s
  user    0m0,821s
  sys     0m0,185s

This is because it imports various DNS and crypto libraries (which
in return do setup a lot of things like gather entropy and the like).
With this patch this reduces to:

  $ time sudo /usr/bin/cinder-rootwrap /etc/cinder/rootwrap.conf id
  uid=0(root) gid=0(root) groups=0(root)

  real    0m1,279s
  user    0m0,192s
  sys     0m0,060s

which is, depending on which metrics you're looking at, up to 4 times
faster.

Change-Id: If098738924e78e76d1c19a329dd8db509022c922

subject: Detach from the parent using fork and exit
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-03-13 03:14:17.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_rootwrap/daemon.py', 'oslo_rootwrap/client.py', 'oslo_rootwrap/tests/test_functional.py'], 'message': 'Detach from the parent using fork and exit

Today, every rootwrap daemon process is associated with its
parent sudo command, which serves no purpose.
In traditional unix programming, daemon processes call daemon(3)
to detach from their parents. Follow the tradition to kill those
useless sudo processes.

Change-Id: If824ccfa772404a40727b8dfd10c78da17730569
'}]
commit_message:
Detach from the parent using fork and exit

Today, every rootwrap daemon process is associated with its
parent sudo command, which serves no purpose.
In traditional unix programming, daemon processes call daemon(3)
to detach from their parents. Follow the tradition to kill those
useless sudo processes.

Change-Id: If824ccfa772404a40727b8dfd10c78da17730569

commit_message:
[PoC] Add new kind of check called 'tags'

Add new check kind for matching tag. Auth token from Keystone now
exposes 'project_tags' and several sub components related to the
attribute now accept new attribute.

Admin can control this kind of check using tag based policy per
project. Possible use cases are look like

- "tags:production"
- "tags:develop"
- "tags:staging and tags:test"
- "tags:%(tags)s"

Tag is orginally list attribute so that this kind of check match
two specified lists are overlapped. If there were any matched tagging
from two lists, check returns True.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/654301
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/654309
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/654307
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/654305

Change-Id: I7f450344d93424dc6c9379ae905e87f8f0dac09b
Closes-bug: #1807697
Closes-bug: #1825336

commit_message:
Create OPA check

This creates a simple check that uses Open Policy Agent to evaluate
policy.

The recommended deployment is to use a system daemon or a sidecar
container, so the code is pretty simple to address that. However, it is
possible to use TLS for authentication/authorization, thus the option to
use TLS is available here.

Change-Id: Idd909c515a327bf20bb098b7ea708d7a2b549f16

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2019-10-28 08:13:41.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/tests/unit/drivers/modules/test_agent_base_vendor.py', 'ironic/drivers/modules/agent_base_vendor.py', 'releasenotes/notes/sofware_raid_use_rootfs_uuid-f61eb671d696d251.yaml'], 'message': "Software RAID: Identify the root fs via its UUID from image metadata

In order to install the bootloader on instances with software RAID,
the IPA needs to chroot into the deployed image's root fs. Currently,
the IPA assumes the first partition to contain the root fs, so this
breaks with images where this is not the case. The proposed change
extracts the root fs UUID from the image's metadata instead and
passes it to the IPA (in the same way this is done for partition
images). It keeps the current behaviour to send the UUID extracted
from the driver internal info in case the metadata is not set on
the image. For the time being, the IPA completely ignores the UUID
passed anyway, so to make this fully work the IPA will also need
to be patched.

Change-Id: I69bd53aa24b7b10384dc1399a0acaa21d38d6bd9
Story: #2006649
Task: #37081
"}]
commit_message:
Software RAID: Identify the root fs via its UUID from image metadata

In order to install the bootloader on instances with software RAID,
the IPA needs to chroot into the deployed image's root fs. Currently,
the IPA assumes the first partition to contain the root fs, so this
breaks with images where this is not the case. The proposed change
extracts the root fs UUID from the image's metadata instead and
passes it to the IPA (in the same way this is done for partition
images). It keeps the current behaviour to send the UUID extracted
from the driver internal info in case the metadata is not set on
the image. For the time being, the IPA completely ignores the UUID
passed anyway, so to make this fully work the IPA will also need
to be patched.

Change-Id: I69bd53aa24b7b10384dc1399a0acaa21d38d6bd9
Story: #2006649
Task: #37081

opentracing to allow all consumers of keystoneauth library
to become compatible with OpenTracing (ex. CNCF Jaeger).

     http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-April/005006.html

     https://review.openstack.org/#/q/status:open+topic:opentracing

commit_message:
[WIP] Make osprofiler OpenTracing-compatible

Changes:
 * Switch to OpenTracing instrumentation in web middleware, sqlalchemy
   handlers and trace decorator

   osprofiler format

     http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-April/005006.html

commit_message:
Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for feature/nats-driver

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as feature/nats-driver branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I7bef96165091b2b1af1dd0735e70737d31144500

commit_message:
Remove some description from oslo policy

A lot of the content about how rules work and the rule syntax from
https://docs.openstack.org/oslo.policy/latest/reference/api/oslo_policy.policy.html
should move somewhere into the user section of that guide. That
probably means moving it out of the source code and into the doc tree.

bug-list https://bugs.launchpad.net/oslo.policy/+bug/1713055

python3.5 was the only supported python3 version on Xenial, now that we have

See ML discussion here [1] for context.

commit_message:
Change python3.5 job to python3.7 job on Stein+

python3.5 was the only supported python3 version on Xenial, now that we have
Bionic Beaver nodes that support python3.7, lets switch to testing with
python3.7 in addition with python3.6 in Stein and beyond.
See ML discussion here [1] for context.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-October/135632.html

Change-Id: Idcd8fd73efddf9ef82dcb55ebbc20c8f08bcfb6d
Signed-off-by: Charles Short <chucks@redhat.com>

You can find the discussion about it here:
(see Doug Hellmann comments)
  - https://review.openstack.org/#/c/303581/

Change-Id: I15d1216a2554da950d09624dc98bcc4dd0be294f
"}]
commit_message:
Move all loggers under 'oslo.' package namespace

Replace all the non-namespaced prefixs 'oslo_' of loggers names with 'oslo.'
to maintain backward compatibility with log level configurations in production
For example: oslo=WARN or oslo.messaging=INFO

You can find the discussion about it here:
(see Doug Hellmann comments)
  - https://review.openstack.org/#/c/303581/

Change-Id: I15d1216a2554da950d09624dc98bcc4dd0be294f

subject: Retry to declare a queue after internal error
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-04-23 07:49:37.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_messaging/_drivers/impl_rabbit.py'], 'message': "Retry to declare a queue after internal error

Without this commit, the client can lose the messages, because the
client does not handler the 'AMQP internal error 541',
read here [2] for details.
The fix retries to create the queue after a delay.
When the virtual-host is ready the declare does not fail.
This is a rare condiction, please read the bug [1] for details.

Closes-Bug: #1822778

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/oslo.messaging/+bug/1822778
[2] https://www.rabbitmq.com/amqp-0-9-1-reference.html

Change-Id: I7ab1f9d21ebb807285bf1422bc14cc6e07dcd32a
(cherry picked from commit 4d2787227b00b973973554f7387e621d2664c0d8)
"}]
commit_message:
Retry to declare a queue after internal error

Without this commit, the client can lose the messages, because the
client does not handler the 'AMQP internal error 541',
read here [2] for details.
The fix retries to create the queue after a delay.
When the virtual-host is ready the declare does not fail.
This is a rare condiction, please read the bug [1] for details.

Closes-Bug: #1822778

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/oslo.messaging/+bug/1822778
[2] https://www.rabbitmq.com/amqp-0-9-1-reference.html

Change-Id: I7ab1f9d21ebb807285bf1422bc14cc6e07dcd32a
(cherry picked from commit 4d2787227b00b973973554f7387e621d2664c0d8)

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-12-07 19:21:49.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/integrated-osprofiler-support-e2e6b4847aebf514.yaml', 'oslo_messaging/tests/functional/test_profiling.py', 'test-requirements.txt', 'oslo_messaging/rpc/dispatcher.py', 'lower-constraints.txt', 'oslo_messaging/rpc/client.py'], 'message': 'RFC: Add osprofiler tracing for RPC calls

This proposed patch will integrate osprofiling into the RPC library to
allow projects to trace flows across RPC calls.

Projects like Nova and Neutron have taken steps to instrument their
code to support tracing across RPC calls.  This patch is based on
their work (IIUC this patch will not conflict with their
implementation - TBD if true)

Projects that want to trace across RPC calls will need to add
tracepoints as necessary to client code making RPC calls and wrap the
endpoint classes on the server properly - see the additional unit test
as an example.

Change-Id: I0bcf7ec932d0d9282b3063dccb7107e69e62eb21
'}]
commit_message:
RFC: Add osprofiler tracing for RPC calls

This proposed patch will integrate osprofiling into the RPC library to
allow projects to trace flows across RPC calls.

Projects like Nova and Neutron have taken steps to instrument their
code to support tracing across RPC calls.  This patch is based on
their work (IIUC this patch will not conflict with their
implementation - TBD if true)

Projects that want to trace across RPC calls will need to add
tracepoints as necessary to client code making RPC calls and wrap the
endpoint classes on the server properly - see the additional unit test
as an example.

Change-Id: I0bcf7ec932d0d9282b3063dccb7107e69e62eb21

subject: WIP Queue messages on consumer rather than an external queue
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-17 19:04:44.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_messaging/rpc/dispatcher.py', 'oslo_messaging/rpc/server.py'], 'message': "WIP Queue messages on consumer rather than an external queue

This is a rough PoC on how this might be achieved. This is motivated by
a few goals:

1. It would be nice to have RPC dispatch prioritize different methods.

2. It would be nice to queue messages in a place that a service can
introspect easily. RabbitMQ appears to be the commonly used queue at the
moment but it's not easy to query it in order to determine if some RPC
call is in the queue vs it was consumed and dropped.

Change-Id: If669f7c5578bbc4e55379af4c3b901ee98eb0bec
"}]
commit_message:
WIP Queue messages on consumer rather than an external queue

This is a rough PoC on how this might be achieved. This is motivated by
a few goals:

1. It would be nice to have RPC dispatch prioritize different methods.

2. It would be nice to queue messages in a place that a service can
introspect easily. RabbitMQ appears to be the commonly used queue at the
moment but it's not easy to query it in order to determine if some RPC
call is in the queue vs it was consumed and dropped.

Change-Id: If669f7c5578bbc4e55379af4c3b901ee98eb0bec

subject: Fix socket getting in the set_transport_socket_timeout()
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-08-24 09:10:47.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_messaging/_drivers/impl_rabbit.py'], 'message': "Fix socket getting in the set_transport_socket_timeout()

The set_transport_socket_timeout() use self.channel to obtain the socket,
but if during reconnection the set_transport_socket_timeout was called
before _set_current_channel(new_channel) it leads to the:

[-] Failed to get socket attribute: 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'sock' set_transport_socket_timeout

because self.channel was closed at this moment.

So, to fix it just use self.connection.connection.sock instead of
self.channel.*

Change-Id: I0dae7ee96ce052dec4c71c06b975966596cae011
"}]
commit_message:
Fix socket getting in the set_transport_socket_timeout()

The set_transport_socket_timeout() use self.channel to obtain the socket,
but if during reconnection the set_transport_socket_timeout was called
before _set_current_channel(new_channel) it leads to the:

[-] Failed to get socket attribute: 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'sock' set_transport_socket_timeout

because self.channel was closed at this moment.

So, to fix it just use self.connection.connection.sock instead of
self.channel.*

Change-Id: I0dae7ee96ce052dec4c71c06b975966596cae011

commit_message:
Fix tox environments

Work items:

* Removed the globale-requirements constraint. Since python-cloudkittyclient
  is now part of the global requirements, the upstream requirements
  file can't be used anymore.

* Add cliff to docs requirements.

* Change cloudkittyclient namespace names: Having a dot in a namespace
  name causes the "autoprogram-cliff" to use the "application mode".

Change-Id: I8020d816b3397550fbcbd42cc14a9861bca7ae80

subject: Stop configuring install_command in tox.
revisions:
[{'number': 10, 'created': '2019-12-17 22:56:37.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': "Stop configuring install_command in tox.

Currently, we are overriding 'install_command' to use 'pip'. This is
considered poor behavior and 'python -m pip' should be used instead:

https://snarky.ca/why-you-should-use-python-m-pip/

It turns out that this is the the default value provided by tox:

https://tox.readthedocs.io/en/latest/config.html#conf-install_command

So we can remove the line and simply use the default value.

Change-Id: I5b32b7558525065847550f422b86e12281f71a8a
"}]
commit_message:
Stop configuring install_command in tox.

Currently, we are overriding 'install_command' to use 'pip'. This is
considered poor behavior and 'python -m pip' should be used instead:

https://snarky.ca/why-you-should-use-python-m-pip/

It turns out that this is the the default value provided by tox:

https://tox.readthedocs.io/en/latest/config.html#conf-install_command

So we can remove the line and simply use the default value.

Change-Id: I5b32b7558525065847550f422b86e12281f71a8a

Under rare cases, during running log_opt_values method, a different thread may try to

Change-Id: I17492a216579bed85e935e72506e491f22fee84f

commit_message:
force log_opt_values looping through a list copy

Under rare cases, during running log_opt_values method, a different thread may try to
register new groups which will eventually raise an runtime error. So I think it is safer
to first make a copy of keys and going through them.

bug: https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1856312
Change-Id: I17492a216579bed85e935e72506e491f22fee84f

subject: Only set "unknown" in LSP that makes sense
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2019-08-22 08:55:48.000000000', 'files': ['networking_ovn/common/ovn_client.py', 'networking_ovn/common/constants.py', 'networking_ovn/common/maintenance.py'], 'message': 'Only set "unknown" in LSP that makes sense

Prior to this patch, the "unknown" address was being set the logical
switch ports solely based on whether the port security was enabled or
disabled. That's not how it's intended to work.

With this patch the "unknown" address is only set to the normal logical
switch ports, those which types are "router", "localnet" or "localport"
won't be affected.

The maintenance task was updated to correct this behavior for existing
ports (the maintenance was suppose to be removed in the T cycle, this
patch bumps it to U cycle instead due to this change).

Closes-Bug: #1838535
Related-Bug: #1815270
Change-Id: I3c01bd7d1685c8a7e13a55e545e98baf19e9a0f9
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Only set "unknown" in LSP that makes sense

Prior to this patch, the "unknown" address was being set the logical
switch ports solely based on whether the port security was enabled or
disabled. That's not how it's intended to work.

With this patch the "unknown" address is only set to the normal logical
switch ports, those which types are "router", "localnet" or "localport"
won't be affected.

The maintenance task was updated to correct this behavior for existing
ports (the maintenance was suppose to be removed in the T cycle, this
patch bumps it to U cycle instead due to this change).

Closes-Bug: #1838535
Related-Bug: #1815270
Change-Id: I3c01bd7d1685c8a7e13a55e545e98baf19e9a0f9
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Create Validations logging directory

The Validation framework is logging every execution in the
/var/log/validations directory and this one should be created first.

This patch also get rid of the validations user creation because we
don't need anymore since Mistral is out for the validator CLI.

Change-Id: I502c38d3f27db3c6f62a47190136dd03627956bc
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Cache security group driver

Change I0932c652fb455fe10239215a93e183ea947234e3 from Mitaka
was a performance improvement to cache the loaded security
group driver since the API calls get_openstack_security_group_driver
a lot. That performance fix was regressed with change
Ia4a8d9954bf456253101b936f8b4ff513aaa73b2 in Newton.

This caches the loaded security group driver once again. This
is pretty similar to the original change except simpler since
we don't have to account for the skip_policy_check flag.

Change-Id: Icacc763f19db6dc90e72af32e17d480775ad5edf
Closes-Bug: #1825018

commit_message:
Use "via" in gateway dictionary in Linux Bridge agent

The gateway IP address in the gateway dictionary returned by
"ip_lib.list_ip_routes" is stored in "via".

"priority" parameter is changed to "metric", to match input and
output parameters.

Change-Id: I67ae473dca8d706f963c3b55b9410f9a79d7f32b
Closes-Bug: #1855759

commit_message:
Add netcontrold service for DPDK roles

netcontrold rebalances the overloaded queues within
available PMD threads to avoid packet loss. Add
support to enable this service in the DPDK deployments.

Change-Id: Ia0ec2a3db0626e9a93ef591d0bc4f3a53d98820f
(cherry picked from commit 4d3b5be7e6fc40aa9491f33562456de0688aa0d5)

commit_message:
Properly set loopback_users via rabbitmq::loopback_users

Sorta resurrecting https://review.opendev.org/#/c/324016/ now that
https://github.com/voxpupuli/puppet-rabbitmq/pull/699 merged.

This commit prevents a duplicate entry for loopback_users in the
rabbitmq.config file:

{loopback_users, [<<"guest">>]},
{loopback_users, []},

keeping only the expected empty array.

Change-Id: I0c291bf5611f02983c430179206556bae3b38736
(cherry picked from commit 04a5937e1f1482dd3115ddc809c555abea87e69d)

subject: Revert "Add ntpdate to ensure hwclock sync"
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-12-13 22:17:42.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/timesync/chrony-baremetal-ansible.yaml', 'deployment/time/ntp-baremetal-puppet.yaml'], 'message': 'Revert "Add ntpdate to ensure hwclock sync"

This reverts commit 0a6199bded71ee5b478e6a5982f5958bdcb6484b.

This doesn't actually work because if ntpd is started, 
ntpdate cannot run. We would need another solution to
ensure the system clock is synced under ntp.  The ntpdate
service is a oneshot service so it just runs a single
ntpdate (and hwclock) on boot.

Change-Id: Iaed98cbc3a15defbd07f54d7e3f49676011038d5
Related-Bug: #1856259
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Add ntpdate to ensure hwclock sync"

This reverts commit 0a6199bded71ee5b478e6a5982f5958bdcb6484b.

This doesn't actually work because if ntpd is started, 
ntpdate cannot run. We would need another solution to
ensure the system clock is synced under ntp.  The ntpdate
service is a oneshot service so it just runs a single
ntpdate (and hwclock) on boot.

Change-Id: Iaed98cbc3a15defbd07f54d7e3f49676011038d5
Related-Bug: #1856259

subject: Add load_balancer_id earlier to amphora info
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2019-12-02 19:52:48.000000000', 'files': ['octavia/tests/unit/controller/worker/v2/tasks/test_database_tasks.py', 'octavia/controller/worker/v1/flows/amphora_flows.py', 'octavia/controller/worker/v1/tasks/database_tasks.py', 'octavia/controller/worker/v2/tasks/database_tasks.py', 'octavia/tests/unit/controller/worker/v1/tasks/test_database_tasks.py', 'octavia/controller/worker/v2/flows/amphora_flows.py'], 'message': "Add load_balancer_id earlier to amphora info

When we create amphora for specific loadbalancer it would be
good to get info about mapping pair loadbalancer-amphora as
soon as possible.

For example, if admin needs to debug connectivity issues with amphora 
VMs - loadbalancer_id won't be set until AmphoraComputeConnectivityWait
task succeded,( which is never for such case) so he has to go to worker 
logs to understand which amphora is related to currently creating 
loadbalancer.

To simplify that - if amphora is creating for loadbalancer
add setting loadbalancer_id in UpdateAmphoraInfo task (pass as
an optional argument).

Change-Id: Ibf30f6368cb811043962844ae5f89e9dfcae2361
"}]
commit_message:
Add load_balancer_id earlier to amphora info

When we create amphora for specific loadbalancer it would be
good to get info about mapping pair loadbalancer-amphora as
soon as possible.

For example, if admin needs to debug connectivity issues with amphora 
VMs - loadbalancer_id won't be set until AmphoraComputeConnectivityWait
task succeded,( which is never for such case) so he has to go to worker 
logs to understand which amphora is related to currently creating 
loadbalancer.

To simplify that - if amphora is creating for loadbalancer
add setting loadbalancer_id in UpdateAmphoraInfo task (pass as
an optional argument).

Change-Id: Ibf30f6368cb811043962844ae5f89e9dfcae2361

commit_message:
OvS DPDK parameters failing in NIC Partitioning

This change is to fix the finding DPDK device name issue in
OvS DPDK derive parameters logic. Currently mistral fails to
derive OvS DPDK parameters in NIC Partitioning and getting
error 'Unable to determine NUMA node for DPDK NIC:'

Change-Id: I8dfc2494d35d5fce52d573f9edcafbe11ab7faac
Closes-Bug: #1855159
(cherry picked from commit 9641cc2ccb9d6bc5757f2bb888b374dedc2d2733)
(cherry picked from commit dd354ee4d6eb05c003de40006cbdb0895099f2c8)

Update and Remove deprecated variables from Cisco Nexus Config.

  provider_vlan_name_prefix, persistent_switch_config,
  never_cache_ssh_connection, ssh_port, switch_replay_count,

(cherry picked from commit f45169f38db4333d60841136fe3fab951221eeb6)

commit_message:
CiscoNexus: Update and Remove deprecated vars

Backward compatible backport (modified by hand).

Update and Remove deprecated variables from Cisco Nexus Config.
* Deprecated variables include vlan_name_prefix, svi_round_robin,
  provider_vlan_name_prefix, persistent_switch_config,
  never_cache_ssh_connection, ssh_port, switch_replay_count,
  nexus_driver, and host_key_checks.
* Change config replay to on by defaulting switch_heartbeat_time=30.
* Replaced method of configurating host_ports_mapping config.

Change-Id: Iee2f869c4054f1120d224994aba8c827f981e6c0
Closes-bug:  #1793379
(cherry picked from commit f45169f38db4333d60841136fe3fab951221eeb6)

subject: [ceph-client] update pool validation logic
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 8898, 'name': 'Chris Wedgwood', 'email': 'cw@f00f.org', 'username': 'anticw'}, {'_account_id': 18511, 'name': 'Brian Wickersham', 'email': 'bkw86@bellsouth.net', 'username': 'bw6938'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 22636, 'name': 'Cliff Parsons', 'email': 'cliffhparsons@aol.com', 'username': 'cliffparsons'}, {'_account_id': 23928, 'name': 'Pete Birley', 'email': 'petebirley@gmail.com', 'username': 'portdirect'}, {'_account_id': 28372, 'name': 'chinasubbareddy mallavarapu', 'email': 'cr3938@att.com', 'username': 'chinasubbareddy'}, {'_account_id': 29974, 'name': 'Stephen Taylor', 'email': 'stephen.taylor.1@att.com', 'username': 'st053q'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2019-12-17 21:46:04.000000000', 'files': ['ceph-client/templates/bin/_helm-tests.sh.tpl'], 'message': '[ceph-client] update pool validation logic

Starting in Nautilus, setting pgp_num step is no longer necessary
as long as pgp_num and pg_num currently match, pgp_num will automatically
track any pg_num changes.
More importantly, the adjustment of pgp_num to migrate data and (eventually)
converge to pg_num is done gradually to limit the data migration load on the system.

Change-Id: I491b6eac35b486698c0eef256ca91dac217f8929
'}]
commit_message:
[ceph-client] update pool validation logic

Starting in Nautilus, setting pgp_num step is no longer necessary
as long as pgp_num and pg_num currently match, pgp_num will automatically
track any pg_num changes.
More importantly, the adjustment of pgp_num to migrate data and (eventually)
converge to pg_num is done gradually to limit the data migration load on the system.

Change-Id: I491b6eac35b486698c0eef256ca91dac217f8929

commit_message:
Add revert_snapshot_based_resize conductor RPC method

This adds the conductor ComputeTaskManager method
revert_snapshot_based_resize along with the related conductor
RPC API client method which will be an RPC cast from the API
for a revertResize server action.

Part of blueprint cross-cell-resize

Change-Id: Ia6b6b25238963a5f60349267da6d07cb740982f4

subject: Ensure option groups don't change during logging
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-12-13 16:24:41.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_config/cfg.py'], 'message': "Ensure option groups don't change during logging

oslo.config allows us to configure groups and options dynamically. This
can cause a race with our logging as we attempt to iterate through
option groups that are changing under our feet. This wouldn't be a huge
issue, since these are just logs are we can always log again, if needed,
but we store groups in a dictionary and Python doesn't like us changing
the size of a dict it's iterating through:

  RuntimeError: dictionary changed size during iteration

Given that we're only reading through this option group and don't need
to worry about a group _disappearing_, the solution is pretty simple:
create a copy of our option group names ahead of time so we don't need
to worry about new ones coming and messing things up.

No tests are included since this is a race and the only way I see to
reproduce this would involve lots of ugly threading.

Change-Id: Id3b28465d645a24f0fcebff2dd68a9bd30e21594
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1856312
"}]
commit_message:
Ensure option groups don't change during logging

oslo.config allows us to configure groups and options dynamically. This
can cause a race with our logging as we attempt to iterate through
option groups that are changing under our feet. This wouldn't be a huge
issue, since these are just logs are we can always log again, if needed,
but we store groups in a dictionary and Python doesn't like us changing
the size of a dict it's iterating through:

  RuntimeError: dictionary changed size during iteration

Given that we're only reading through this option group and don't need
to worry about a group _disappearing_, the solution is pretty simple:
create a copy of our option group names ahead of time so we don't need
to worry about new ones coming and messing things up.

No tests are included since this is a race and the only way I see to
reproduce this would involve lots of ugly threading.

Change-Id: Id3b28465d645a24f0fcebff2dd68a9bd30e21594
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1856312

revisions:
[{'number': 14, 'created': '2019-12-17 19:03:58.000000000', 'files': ['zuul.d/layout.yaml'], 'message': "zuul: all functional jobs now depend on linter job first

There is no need to run functional jobs if the linters don't pass; often
due to syntax errors.
This patch will help to save CI resources when syntax isn't good in a
patch.

Change-Id: I1a45fdc6c818e00cd97fef12dc608ee4550279cb
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
zuul: all functional jobs now depend on linter job first

There is no need to run functional jobs if the linters don't pass; often
due to syntax errors.
This patch will help to save CI resources when syntax isn't good in a
patch.

Change-Id: I1a45fdc6c818e00cd97fef12dc608ee4550279cb
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>

This is meant to replace legacy-tempest-dsvm-full-devstack-plugin-nfs

Check the plugin against all the supported branches
(but ocata) to prevent regressions.

subject: Always source lib/apache when lib/tls is used
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-02-18 11:12:57.000000000', 'files': ['projects/30_swift/upgrade.sh', 'clean.sh', 'projects/40_glance/shutdown.sh', 'projects/40_glance/upgrade.sh', 'projects/70_cinder/shutdown.sh', 'projects/70_cinder/upgrade.sh', 'projects/30_swift/shutdown.sh', 'projects/50_neutron/shutdown.sh'], 'message': 'Always source lib/apache when lib/tls is used

When tls-proxy is enabled, few functions in lib/tls relies on lib/apache
functions (restart_apache_server, stop_apache_server, enable_apache_site,
enable_apache_mod).
It is thus necessary to source lib/apache whenever lib/tls is used.

Change-Id: Ia9ffdc490d0cba04a084d572312e177b19791585
'}]
commit_message:
Always source lib/apache when lib/tls is used

When tls-proxy is enabled, few functions in lib/tls relies on lib/apache
functions (restart_apache_server, stop_apache_server, enable_apache_site,
enable_apache_mod).
It is thus necessary to source lib/apache whenever lib/tls is used.

Change-Id: Ia9ffdc490d0cba04a084d572312e177b19791585

commit_message:
Make nova_novncproxy use BUMPs

We have a lock of VNC version inside repo_packages [1]. We should
try using it as otherwise this may result in broken console

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible/src/branch/stable/stein/playbooks/defaults/repo_packages/nova_consoles.yml#L33

Change-Id: Icd1fe43c9fa3ab16f9bdaf0a2cb60854c0e15e97
(cherry picked from commit 1de7b24e701bda75e0fc1d019510f71f16608502)

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-12-17 14:47:57.000000000', 'files': ['tripleo_ansible/roles/tripleo-keystone-resources/defaults/main.yml'], 'message': "tripleo-keystone-resources: reduce permissions for clouds.yaml

commit_message:
tripleo-keystone-resources: reduce permissions for clouds.yaml

0644 was too open, and it's problematic for security reasons.
Let's reduce to 0600; so only root can read and write the file.

Change-Id: Ic463aa66b719bfc8f860662e8387f3eea6faaf01

commit_message:
Stop supporting python2

We're peeling python2 from libraries now, so Stop running python2
versions of test jobs. Leaving removing the test jobs themselves
for the moment as they're still used in other repos.

Change-Id: Ic6d56e3636b757201d83649f075005ed3ae1e1a6

commit_message:
Create /var/log/journal directory during step-0

While I93dcc57aff63b91dab475b0c114b278324434e41 did the right thing, it
didn't do it in the right place.

This patch adds the creation without removing the misplaced code, so
that we can do an easy backport to Train.
A follow-up will be the actual revert of the other change.

Change-Id: Id937389e4eda5c1fc4634ab14695390a09300468
Closes-Bug: #1856278

commit_message:
Fix pep8 errors found by hacking 2.0.0

The new hacking release found some pep8 errors, fix them.
Unfortunately, moving to 2.0.0 pulled a thread with other
dependencies causing issues, so for now pin it below
1.2.0 to get the gate functioning again.

commit_message:
HA: enable cluster-common-tag naming scheme by default

Since Id369154d147cd5cf0a6f997bf806084fc7580e01, HA services
can now be configured to use a floating container image name
"cluster-common-tag/<servicename>:pcmklatest" to allow
minor update to a new image without service disruption, even
when the namespace changes in the image URI configured in Heat.

Enable that new naming scheme by default for pacemaker deployments.

Closes-Bug: #1854730

to allow minor update to arbitrary use container image name whose

Change-Id: I7a63e8e2d9457c5025f3d70aeed6922e24958049

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-04-25 09:49:48.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'Use upper constraints from opendev.org

oslo.cache uses a simple curl command in its tox_install.sh
to fetch the upper-constraints, and curl does not follow redirects
that are now in place due to move to opendev.org.

This breaks running tox-based tests w/o overriding the
UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE which upstream CI does,
for example running tox locally.

Change-Id: Ifcb555c8f4ccb813b48c613c79dceb4bf23318eb
(cherry picked from commit 6eceb160eaaebbc6ea04768f62876738aa61c2d1)
'}]
commit_message:
Use upper constraints from opendev.org

oslo.cache uses a simple curl command in its tox_install.sh
to fetch the upper-constraints, and curl does not follow redirects
that are now in place due to move to opendev.org.

This breaks running tox-based tests w/o overriding the
UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE which upstream CI does,
for example running tox locally.

Change-Id: Ifcb555c8f4ccb813b48c613c79dceb4bf23318eb
(cherry picked from commit 6eceb160eaaebbc6ea04768f62876738aa61c2d1)

commit_message:
Ceph Nautilus compatibility

This change updates the Ceph charts to use Ceph Nautilus images
built on Ubuntu Bionic instead of Xenial. The mirror that hosts
Ceph packages only provides Nautilus packages for Bionic at
present, so this is necessary for Nautilus deployment.

There are also several configuration and scripting changes
included to provide compatibility with Ceph Nautilus. Most of
these simply allow existing logic to execute for Nautilus
deployments, but some logical changes are required to support
Nautilus as well.

NOTE: The cephfs test has been disabled because it was failing
the gate. This test has passed in multiple dev environments, and
since cephfs isn't used by any openstack-helm-infra components we
don't want this to block getting this change merged. The gate
issue will be investigated and addressed in a subsequent patch
set.

Change-Id: Id2d9d7b35d4dc66e93a0aacc9ea514e85ae13467

commit_message:
Reduce osh-infra-logging job scope

This updates the osh-infra-logging single node job to omit the
fluentbit deployment step, as having multiple logging daemonsets
deployed to the single node jobs is causing IO issues. Also, it
was noted that the fluentd-deployment step was missing the
overrides to move the fluentd-deployment release from utilizing a
daemonset to a deployment. This resulted in 3 logging daemons
being deployed to a single host

Change-Id: I4a0c5550e6ea6a331aab0082a975f161e65704bf
Signed-off-by: Steve Wilkerson <sw5822@att.com>

commit_message:
Add support to configure pcsd bind address

Add support to configure pcsd bind address so that we can
make pcsd listen on specific address instead of all interfaces
on the node.

Related-Bug: #1856626
Change-Id: I14d44d983259b4b9fb56173a8d538b3400644805

commit_message:
[fix] Allow cluster OS upgrade without specifying kube_tag

If kube_tag is not specified in the new cluster_template, the existing
kube_tag should be reused. At the moment, we simply see this error which
does not make any sense:

    $ openstack coe cluster upgrade k8s k8s-alt
    '\'kube_tag\'\n (HTTP 500) (Request-ID: req-652883e9-05f3-43f1-b94d-8c6e0de75a2e)

Story: 2005201
Task: 37712

Change-Id: Ic15ad96a13f18c820bba592d4550f3a4fa951ffb
